name: various
trans: a. 各种各样的，不同种类的

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: variable
trans: a. 多变的；可变的，可更改的；变量

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: design
trans: n. 设计；布局；构思vt. 设计

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: significant
trans: a. 重要的，有意义的；重大的；显著的；意味深长的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: significance
trans: n. 重要性，意义

sentences.english: a decision of major political significance
sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

name: operation
trans: n. 操作；手术；业务；运算；经营

sentences.english: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

detailed_translations.english: an action done by a computer

name: operational
trans: a. 操作的；运营的；可使用的；军事行动的

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

name: technique
trans: n. 技巧；技术；技能

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

name: technical
trans: a. 技术的；技能的；技巧的；专业的

sentences.english: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

sentences.english: I have no technical knowledge at all.
sentences.chinese: 我一点技术知识都没有。

sentences.english: technical training
sentences.chinese: 技术培训

detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

name: technician
trans: n. 技术员；技师；技巧精湛者

sentences.english: a laboratory technician
sentences.chinese: 实验室技术人员

sentences.english: a hospital technician
sentences.chinese: 医院技术人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly

name: attribute
trans: vt. 把......归因于；认为是......所为n. 特质，特征

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: contribute
trans: v. 捐献；做贡献vi. 促成【僻】v. 是......的原因之一

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: output
trans: n. 产量，输出量；（计算机的）输出信息

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: outlook
trans: n. 观点；世界观；人生观；前景；景色

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: outlet
trans: n. 发泄途径；出路；排放管；专卖店

sentences.english: a waste water outlet
sentences.chinese: 污水排放口

sentences.english: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
sentences.chinese: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or hole through which something such as a liquid or gas can flow out

name: mechanical
trans: a. 机械的；机械般的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；机械装置

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 促进；使便利

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: certificate
trans: n. 证明；证书；结业证书

sentences.english: birth/death/marriage certificate (=giving details of someone’s birth, death, or marriage)
sentences.chinese: 出生/死亡/结婚证书

sentences.english: a degree certificate
sentences.chinese: 学位证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 证书，证件，执照；（毕业）文凭，合格证书
detailed_translations.english: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格；技能条件

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品vt. 牺牲

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: artificial
trans: a. 人工的；人造的；假装的；人为的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: factor
trans: n. 因素；要素

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；［pl］政治事务；私人业务；风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者vt. 目击；见证，经历

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: review
trans: vt. 回顾；审视n. 审查；评论

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: divide
trans: v. （使）分开vt. 除以；分配n. 差异；分歧【僻】v. 使产生分歧

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: provision
trans: n. 提供，供给；准备；条款

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧；才智

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: confer
trans: vi. 商议vt. 授予，赋予

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: inference
trans: n. 推论；结论；推理，推断

sentences.english: There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.
sentences.chinese: 从她的来信可以得到两种推论。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

name: reference
trans: n. 参考；查询；提及

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱；爱好；偏爱的事物；优待

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: offer
trans: vt. 提供；出（价）n. 报价；提议

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: transfer
trans: v. （使）转移；调动n. 转移【僻】n. 转变

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: suffer
trans: v. 遭受，经受

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: comparison
trans: n. 比较；对比

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

name: separate
trans: 独立的，分开的；不同的v. （使）分开

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

name: simplify
trans: vt. 使简化

sentences.english: an attempt to simplify the tax system
sentences.chinese: 简化税制的尝试

sentences.english: The law needs to be simplified.
sentences.chinese: 这部法律需要简化。

sentences.english: a simplified version of the game
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏的简化版

detailed_translations.english: to make something easier or less complicated

name: similar
trans: a. 类似的，相似的

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: eliminate
trans: vt. 排除；消除；淘汰

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: preliminary
trans: a. 初步的n. 初步行动；预赛

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: limit
trans: n. 限制；极限；［pl］范围vt. 限制，限定

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

name: limited
trans: a. 有限的；受限制的；（公司）有限责任的

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

name: superfluous
trans: a. 多余的，不必要的

sentences.english: a modern building with no superfluous decoration
sentences.chinese: 一栋没有多余装饰的现代建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的
detailed_translations.english: more than is needed or wanted

name: superior
trans: a. 更好的；优秀的；上级的n. 上司

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

name: supervise
trans: vt. 监督；管理；指导

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

name: policy
trans: n. 政策；原则；保险单

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

name: politics
trans: n. 政治；钩心斗角

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: political
trans: a. 政治的；政党的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: promote
trans: vt. 促进；晋升；推销

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: provide
trans: vt. 提供

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: prolong
trans: vt. 延长

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: profound
trans: a. 深刻的；极大的；知识渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: profile
trans: n. 侧影；人物简介；轮廓vt. 概述

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: proposal
trans: n. 提议；建议；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: provoke
trans: vt. 激怒；激起，引起，引发

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: profit
trans: n. 利润v. 获益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: upgrade
trans: n. 升级vt. 使升级；提拔；改善

sentences.english: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized.
sentences.chinese: 直升机已经升级并且装上现代化设备。

detailed_translations.english: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

name: graduate
trans: n. 毕业生；学士学位获得者vi. 毕业

sentences.english: a graduate student
sentences.chinese: 研究生

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university
someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree

name: gradual
trans: a. 逐渐的；（斜坡）平缓的

sentences.english: There has been a gradual change in climate.
sentences.chinese: 气候渐渐发生了变化。

sentences.english: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业的逐渐衰退

sentences.english: Education is a gradual process.
sentences.chinese: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

detailed_translations.english: happening slowly over a long period of time

name: degree
trans: n. 程度；学位；度数

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

name: congress
trans: n. 代表大会；［C-］国会，议会

sentences.english: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
sentences.chinese: 执政党工党的代表大会

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc

name: aggressive
trans: a. 挑衅的；积极进取的；富于攻击性的；声势浩大的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: progressive
trans: a. 进步的；先进的；稳步的；逐步的

sentences.english: a progressive administration
sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.english: progressive and forward-looking policies
sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党进步派和保守派之间分歧很大。

detailed_translations.english: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
A progressive is someone who is progressive

name: failure
trans: n. 失败；失败的人（事物）

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

name: pressure
trans: n. 心理压力；压力vt. 迫使

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: measure
trans: vt. 测量；衡量n. 措施；标准

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

name: procedure
trans: n. 程序，步骤；手术

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露，接触；揭露；曝光

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: paradox
trans: n. 矛盾的人（或事物、情况）；悖论

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: paragraph
trans: n. 段，段落

sentences.english: the opening paragraphs of the novel
sentences.chinese: 小说开篇的几个段落

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

name: obvious
trans: a. 明显的，显然的；公认的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: serious
trans: a. 严重的；重要的；严肃的；认真的；需认真思考的

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.english: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

name: cautious
trans: a. 小心的，谨慎的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: ambitious
trans: a. 有野心的，有雄心的；（计划、想法等）宏大的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: anxious
trans: a. 焦虑的；令人焦虑的；流露出忧虑的；渴望的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: regular
trans: a. 有规律的；定期的；频繁的；平常的n. 常客

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: peculiar
trans: a. 奇怪的；特有的，特殊的；不适的

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

name: influence
trans: n. 影响，作用vt. 影响

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: influential
trans: a. 有影响力的n. ［常用pl.］有影响力的人

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: professor
trans: n. 教授

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: professional
trans: 专业的；职业性的n. 内行，专家

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: diverse
trans: a. 不同的；多种多样的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: reverse
trans: vt. 扭转；颠倒（顺序）a. 相反的n.  ［the〜］反面

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: version
trans: n. 版本；说法

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

name: universal
trans: a. 普遍的；全体的；全世界的

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: conversation
trans: n. 谈话，交谈

sentences.english: a telephone conversation
sentences.chinese: 电话交谈

sentences.english: Children quickly get bored by adult conversation.
sentences.chinese: 儿童对成年人的谈话很快就会厌倦。

sentences.english: They had a short conversation in German and seemed to be disagreeing about something.
sentences.chinese: 他们用德语说了一会儿，好像对什么事有分歧。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to carry on a conversation with all this noise in the background.
sentences.chinese: 在这么喧闹的环境中进行谈话是不可能的。

sentences.english: ‘Did you have a good journey?’ he said, trying to make conversation .
sentences.chinese: “你旅途愉快吗？”他问道，试图找话谈。

sentences.english: He was silent, no matter how hard Sofia tried to engage him in conversation .
sentences.chinese: 无论索菲娅怎么引他说话，他就是一声不吭。

sentences.english: After a while, the conversation turned to a friend’s coming wedding.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，话题就转到一个朋友即将举行的婚礼上去了。

sentences.english: They were deep in conversation , relaxed and smiling.
sentences.chinese: 他们谈得很投入，很放松，脸上带着微笑。

sentences.english: He could hear snatches of conversation from across the room.
sentences.chinese: 他从房间对面听得到零星的对话。

detailed_translations.english: an informal talk in which people exchange news, feelings, and thoughts

name: philosophy
trans: n. 哲学；人生哲学

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

name: philosopher
trans: n. 哲学家

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: initial
trans: a. 开始的，最初的vt. 签姓名首字母于n.  ［pl.］（全名的）首字母

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: initiative
trans: n. 主动性【僻】n. 倡议，新方案

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: urban
trans: a. 城市的；都市的；城镇的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: major
trans: a. 主要的；重要的n. 专业vt. 主修

sentences.english: There are two major political parties in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国有两大政党。

sentences.english: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。

sentences.english: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。

sentences.english: the major developments in computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的重大进步

sentences.english: He’s majoring in Political Science.
sentences.chinese: 他主修政治学。

detailed_translations.english: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind
to study something as your main subject at college or university

name: majority
trans: n. 大多数；大部分；多数票【僻】n. 成年的法定年龄

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: apart
trans: ad. 分开；相距；除了......外

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: cognitive
trans: a. 认知的；认识的

sentences.english: cognitive psychology
sentences.chinese: 认知心理学

detailed_translations.english: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: ignore
trans: vt. 忽视，忽略

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: upset
trans: vt. 使生气；搅乱a. 烦恼的；失望的

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: settlement
trans: n. 协议；聚居点n. 解决

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: resident
trans: n. 居民a. （在某地）居住的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: president
trans: n. 总统；董事长

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

name: assess
trans: vt. 评估，评定；估算

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: episode
trans: n. 片段；一段经历；事件；一集

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: import
trans: vt. 进口 n.  ［pl］进口；重要性【僻】n. 含意

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: transport
trans: n. 运输；交通工具vt. 运输

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: reporter
trans: n. 记者

sentences.english: a news reporter
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to write about news events for a newspaper, or to tell people about them on television or on the radio

name: proportion
trans: n. 部分；比例；［C-常用pl.］正确比例；［pl.］规模

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: collect
trans: vt. 收集；领取；收取v. 积聚；募捐【僻】v. 获得

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: collection
trans: n. 收集；收藏品；一群人；一批物品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: select
trans: vt. 选择；挑选a. 精选的；优等的

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

name: selection
trans: n. 选择，挑选；挑选出的人（或物）

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

name: intellectual
trans: a. 智力的；有知识的n. 知识分子

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；器具；乐器；手段

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: instruction
trans: n.  ［pl.］用法说明；［pl.］指示；命令；教导

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

name: destruction
trans: n. 破坏；毁灭

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["weapons of mass destruction"]}
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
sentences.chinese: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏

sentences.english: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏， 毁灭； 消灭
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

name: structure
trans: n. 结构；体系；建筑物

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施，基础建设

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: reliable
trans: a. 可靠的；可信赖的；确凿的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: colleague
trans: n. 同事

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: religious
trans: a. 宗教的；虔诚的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: elite
trans: n. 精英a. 出类拔莘的

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: intelligent
trans: a. 聪明的；智能的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；智能【僻】n. 情报；情报人员

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变；转换

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: level
trans: n. 水平；级别；程度a. 平坦的vt. 使平整

sentences.english: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
sentences.chinese: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

sentences.english: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。

detailed_translations.english: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
flat and not sloping in any direction

name: relevant
trans: a. 相关的；有意义的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: relief
trans: n. 减轻；宽慰；解脱

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: relieve
trans: vt. 减轻；缓解；解除；给......换班

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；培养；购得

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: require
trans: vt. 需要；要求

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: acquisition
trans: n. 获得；收购；购得物

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

name: request
trans: n. /vt. 请求，要求

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

name: permanent
trans: a. 永久的；固定的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: maintain
trans: Vt』栗持；维持；保养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: remain
trans: v. 仍然是；保持vi. 停留

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: manage
trans: v. 管理；设法做到

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: management
trans: n. 管理；管理层

sentences.english: a lack of management skills
sentences.chinese: 缺乏管理技巧

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 一个管理顾问

sentences.english: management training courses
sentences.chinese: 管理培训课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理； 处理； 管理部门， 管理人员
detailed_translations.english: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

name: manner
trans: n. 方式；方法；举止；［pl.］礼貌

sentences.english: He felt some guilt over the manner of her death.
sentences.chinese: 她以这种方式死去，他心里有些内疚。

sentences.english: The issue will be resolved in a manner that is fair to both sides.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将用对双方都公平的方式来解决。

sentences.english: criticism of the manner in which the bishop was appointed
sentences.chinese: 对主教任命方式的批评

sentences.english: She has a calm relaxed manner.
sentences.chinese: 她举止镇定而从容。

sentences.english: Her children all had such good manners.
sentences.chinese: 她的孩子都很有礼貌。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is done or happens

name: routine
trans: n. 常规，惯例a. 日常的；例行的

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: discipline
trans: n. 纪律；训练；学科vt. 训练；管教

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: eligible
trans: a. 有资格的；合格的；（作为婚姻对象）合适的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: plausible
trans: a. 貌似合理的；花言巧语的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导；领导才能

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

name: relationship
trans: n. 关系

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: overlook
trans: vt. 忽视，忽略；俯视

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: overseas
trans: a. 海外的，国外的ad,在海外，在国外

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: overall
trans: a. 总体的；全面的n. 罩衣

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: apply
trans: vi. 申请；适用vt. 应用

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: display
trans: vt. 展示；显示，表现n. 展示；表演

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: complex
trans: a. 复杂的n. （类型相似的）建筑群

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: complicated
trans: a. 复杂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: implicit
trans: a. 含蓄的；隐含其中的；完全的；盲目的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: implication
trans: n.  [c-常用pl.]可能的影响；含意

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: multiple
trans: a. 数量多的；多种多样的n. 倍数

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

name: supplement
trans: n. 补充（物）；增刊vt. 补充

sentences.english: vitamins and other dietary supplements
sentences.chinese: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

detailed_translations.chinese: 增补， 补充； 增刊， 副刊
detailed_translations.english: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

name: complete
trans: a. 完全的；全部的vt. 完成；填写

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: implement
trans: vt. 实施；执行n. 工具

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成；实现

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: supply
trans: n. 供应量；供应vt. 提供，供应

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: comply
trans: vi. 遵从；服从

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: division
trans: n. 划分；分配；分歧

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: device
trans: n. 设备，装置；手段

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: press
trans: v. 按，压vt. 敦促n. 报刊；媒体；印刷机【僻】v. 坚持，反复强调

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: suppress
trans: vt. 镇压,压制；抑制

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；感觉

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: expression
trans: n. 表达；表情

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: split
trans: v. 分裂；分开vt. 分配n. 分裂

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

name: virtue
trans: n. 美德；优点

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: virtual
trans: a. 实际上的；虚拟的

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: withdraw
trans: v. （使）撤回，撤离vt. 提取；收回，撤销

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: temporary
trans: a. 临时的；短暂的；暂时的

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: contemporary
trans: a. 当代的；同一时代的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: severe
trans: a. 严重的；严厉的，重的；极为恶劣的；艰难的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: therapy
trans: n. 治疗；疗法

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: object
trans: n. 物体；对象；目标vi. 反对

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: oppose
trans: vt. 反对；阻挠；抵制；与......对抗

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手，竞争者；反对者

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: local
trans: a. 地方的，本地的n.  [pl.]当地人，本地人

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: locate
trans: vt. 找出......的准确位置；把......安置在vi. 创办于

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: location
trans: n. 位置；地点；定位

sentences.english: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

detailed_translations.english: the act of finding the position of something

name: mode
trans: n. 模式，方式；（设备的）工作状态；风格

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: moderate
trans: a. 适度的；中等的；温和的v. （使）减轻

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: immediate
trans: a. 立即的，即时的；紧急的；直接的；临近的

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: immigrant
trans: n. （外来）移民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: impact
trans: n. 影响，作用v. 有影响

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: inevitable
trans: a. 不可避免的；必然发生的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: innocent
trans: a. 无辜的；清白的；天真的；无恶意的n. 无辜者

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力；深刻见解

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: precede
trans: vt. 发生在......之前，先于；走在......前面；在......之前

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: access
trans: n. 通道；进入；使用权；（资料等的）取得vt. 存取，访问

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: success
trans: n. 成功；成功的人（或事物）

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。
