detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: successful
trans: a. 成功的；有成就的；受欢迎的

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: process
trans: n. 过程vt. 加工；审核；处理（信息）

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: ancestor
trans: n. 祖先，祖宗；原型

sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

trans: n. 经济衰退；退后

sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

trans: a. 必要的；必然的

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

name: necessity
trans: n. 必要；必需品；必然性

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: barely
trans: ad. 勉强；几乎不，几乎没有

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: depend
trans: vi. 依赖，依靠；取决于

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

name: dependent
trans: a. 依赖的；取决于；有瘾的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: independent
trans: a. 独立的；自立的；私营的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: independence
trans: n. 独立；自立

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: expenditure
trans: n. 花费，开支；耗费

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: compensate
trans: vi. 补偿，弥补vt. 赔偿

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: content
trans: n.  ［pl.］内容；目录；容量a. 满足的；愿意

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: continent
trans: n. 大陆；洲

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

name: continuous
trans: a. 持续的，不断的；频繁的；没有间隔的

sentences.chinese: 持续的经济增长

sentences.english: a continuous flow of information
sentences.chinese: 源源不断的信息

detailed_translations.english: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

name: obtain
trans: vt. 获得，得到vi. 存在

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: sustain
trans: vt. 使保持；维持（生命、生存）；遭受；支撑

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: pursue
trans: vt. 追求；从事；追踪；贯彻

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: subsequent
trans: a. 随后的，后来的

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；后果；影响；重要性

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

name: pursuit
trans: n. 追求；寻找；追踪；［C-常用pl.］事业；消遣；爱好

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

name: executive
trans: a. 执行的；高级的n. 管理者；行政部门

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: immune
trans: a. （反应等）免疫的；（对疾病）有免疫力的；不受影响的；免除的

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: community
trans: n. 社区；社会；团体，界

sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: communicate
trans: v. 沟通；传达vt. 传染

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: communication
trans: n. 交流，沟通；传递；通信

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: military
trans: 军事的；军用的n ［the-］军队

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: literary
trans: a. 文学的；书面的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: departure
trans: n. 离开，出发；违背

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: describe
trans: vt. 描述,描写；画出......图形

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

name: deliver
trans: v. 传送，递送vt. 发表；交付

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

name: deny
trans: vt. 否认；拒绝

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

name: detail
trans: n. 细节；详情；资料vt. 详述

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something

name: depict
trans: vt. 描绘，描画；描述

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: determine
trans: vt. 确定；决定；查明；测定

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: demonstrate
trans: vt. 证明；展示；示范vi. 游行示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露

name: delay
trans: v. 延迟，延期vt. 使耽搁n. 延误，耽搁

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: default
trans: n. 默认；违约vi. 违约

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: contradict
trans: vt. 驳斥，反驳；相抵触，相矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: contrary
trans: a. 相反的，相对立的n.  [the~]相反的事实

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: contrast
trans: n. 对比vt. 对比vi. 形成对比

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: controversy
trans: n. 争论，辩论

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: subsidy
trans: n. 补贴,补助金

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: substantial
trans: a. 大量的；坚固的；实质性的

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: sufficient
trans: a. 足够的，充足的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: support
trans: vt. 支持；帮助；赡养n. 支持；资助

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: subtle
trans: a. 细微的，微妙的；巧妙的；敏锐的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: psychology
trans: n. 心理学；心理；心理特征

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

name: technology
trans: n. 科技；技术

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: constituent
trans: n. 成分；选民a. 组成的，构成的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

name: prudent
trans: a. 谨慎的，慎重的；精明的

sentences.english: prudent house buyers
sentences.chinese: 谨慎的购房者

detailed_translations.english: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

name: apparent
trans: a. 明显的，显而易见的；貌似的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: urgent
trans: a. 紧急的，迫切的；急切的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: frequent
trans: a. 频繁的vt. 常去

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

name: inherent
trans: a. 固有的；内在的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: relation
trans: n. 关系；联系；亲戚

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: relative
trans: a. 相对的n. 亲属；亲戚

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: neglect
trans: vt. 忽略，忽视；疏忽；疏于照顾n. 忽视；疏忽

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negative
trans: a. 消极的；负面的；否定的；负的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: negotiate
trans: v. 谈判；协商

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: reality
trans: n. 现实；事实

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

name: realistic
trans: a. 现实的；实事求是的；能够实现的；逼真的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: defend
trans: v. 保卫；防御vt. 为......辩护；捍卫

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: defendant
trans: n. 被告

sentences.english: We find the defendant not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 我们裁定被告无罪。

detailed_translations.english: the person in a court of law who has been  accused  of doing something illegal

name: conduct
trans: n. 行为vt. 进行，实施；引导v. 指挥

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: productive
trans: a. 多产的；生产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: reduction
trans: n. 减少；降低；减价；折扣

sentences.english: strategies for noise reduction
sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

sentences.english: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
sentences.chinese: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

detailed_translations.english: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

name: extreme
trans: a. 极度的；极大的；极端的

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: image
trans: n. 形象；印象；画像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: imagine
trans: v. 想象

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

name: practice
trans: n. 实践；练习；通常做法v. （亦作practise）练习

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: practical
trans: a. 实际的；实用的；切实可行的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；通知

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: monopoly
trans: n. 垄断；垄断企业

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

name: vital
trans: a. 至关重要的；生命的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: survival
trans: n. 存活；生存；残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: vivid
trans: a. 生动的；逼真的；清晰的；鲜艳的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: volume
trans: n. 量；体积；册；音量

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；巨变；大变革

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: involve
trans: vt. 包含；涉及；使参与；需要

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: evolve
trans: v. （使）逐渐形成，逐步发展；进化；进化形成

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: trace
trans: vt. 追溯；追踪n. 踪迹；微量

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: track
trans: n.  [C-常用pl.]踪迹；轨道小径v. 跟踪；追踪

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: trait
trans: n. 特征，特点，特性

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: portray
trans: vt. 描绘；描述；扮演

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

name: abstract
trans: a. 抽象的n. 摘要vt. 提取

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: contract
trans: n. 合同，契约v. 签合同；【僻】v. （使）收缩

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: crisis
trans: n.  （pl.）危机；危急关头

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: critic
trans: n. 批评家；评论家；评论员；批评者

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: criticize
trans: v. 批评；指责vt. 评论

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: criticism
trans: n. 批评；评论

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: critical
trans: a. 批判性的；关键的；批评的；严重的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: prime
trans: a. 首要的；优质的n. 鼎盛时期vt. 事先交代

sentences.english: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。

sentences.english: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。

sentences.english: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Good management is of prime importance in business.
sentences.chinese: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: most important
the time in your life when you are strongest and most active
to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

name: primary
trans: a. 主要的；首要的；最初的；小学教育的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: primitive
trans: a. 原始的；低等的；落后的

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: prior
trans: a. 先前的；优先的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: n. 优先（权）；优先事项

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: stimulate
trans: vt. 刺激；激发；激励

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: distinction
trans: n. 差别；区别；区分；荣誉【僻】n. 优秀，卓越

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能；直觉

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: dominant
trans: a. 占支配地位的；占优势的；（基因）显性的

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: domestic
trans: a. 国内的；家庭的；家用的；驯养的n. 家庭纠纷

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

name: gene
trans: n. 基因

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: general
trans: a. 普遍的；总的；普通的；大体的

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

name: generate
trans: vt产生;引起

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: generation
trans: n. 一代（人）v. 产生

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

name: generous
trans: a. 慷慨的；宽厚的【僻】a. 大量的，丰富的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: ensure
trans: vt. 保证，确保

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险；保障措施；保险费

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: surplus
trans: n. 过剩；盈余a. 过剩的

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: evade
trans: vt. 逃谜；规避；逃脱

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: elaborate
trans: a. 精心制作的；复杂的vt. 精心制作v. 详尽描述

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: efficient
trans: a. 效率高的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: efficiency
trans: n. 效率；效能

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: effective
trans: a. 有效的；生效的；实际的

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: exist
trans: vi. 存在；生存

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: existence
trans: n. 存在；生活

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: explore
trans: vt. 探索v. 勘探

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: examine
trans: vt. 仔细检查；调查

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: exaggerate
trans: v. 夸大

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: exert
trans: vt. 施加（影响、压力等）；运用；努力

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: expand
trans: v. 扩大，增加；扩展

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: expansion
trans: n. 扩张；发展

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: exchange
trans: vt. 交换；交流；兑换n. 交换；交易所

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: tuition
trans: n. 学费；教学，讲授

sentences.english: I had to have extra tuition in maths.
sentences.chinese: 我不得不上数学补习课。

detailed_translations.english: teaching, especially in small groups

name: auction
trans: n.  /vt. 拍卖

sentences.english: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week.
sentences.chinese: 法国艺术家让·科克托的8幅画作将在下周拍卖。

detailed_translations.english: to sell something at an auction
a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

name: option
trans: n. 选择；选修课；选项

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: illusion
trans: n. 幻想；错觉

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: notion
trans: n. 概念；观念；想法

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: persuasion
trans: n. 说服；劝说；信仰

sentences.english: After a little gentle persuasion , Debbie agreed to let us in.
sentences.chinese: 好言劝说了几句后，黛比就同意让我们进去了。

sentences.english: It had taken a great deal of persuasion to get him to accept.
sentences.chinese: 费尽了口舌才让他接受。

sentences.english: She used all her powers of persuasion (= skill at persuading people ) to convince Tilly that it was the right thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 她使尽浑身解数，才劝服蒂莉应该那么做。

detailed_translations.english: the act of persuading someone to do something

name: tradition
trans: n. 传统

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: innovation
trans: n. 创新；革新；新思想；新方法

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声；名誉

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: corporation
trans: n. 大公司，企业；法人

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

name: administration
trans: n. 管理；行政；执行；政府

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。

sentences.english: The health service spends too much on administration.
sentences.chinese: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

detailed_translations.english: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

name: union
trans: n. 联盟；协会；工会；联合

sentences.english: Are you planning to join the union?
sentences.chinese: 你打算加入工会吗？

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["union members"]}
sentences.chinese: 工会会员

detailed_translations.english: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

name: unique
trans: a. 独特的；独一无二的；罕见的；特有的

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: series
trans: n. 一系列；连续；系列节目

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: store
trans: n. 商店；仓库；［pl.］（某类或作某用途的）物品vt. 贮存|

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: storage
trans: n. 贮存（空间）；（计算机的）存储

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs
sentences.chinese: 保管费用

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

name: restore
trans: vt. 恢复；修复；使复原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: absence
trans: n. 缺席，不存在；缺乏

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: presence
trans: n. 出席，在场；出现；存在

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: campaign
trans: n. 运动；战役vi. 领导运动【僻】v. 发起、参加某项运动

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: marine
trans: a. 海洋的；海事的

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: credit
trans: n. 信贷；信用；赊欠；赞扬；学分vt. 信任

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者v. 自愿做

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: voluntary
trans: a. 自愿的

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: sphere
trans: n. 领域；界,圈子；球体；范围

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；［the］大气（层）；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: uneasy
trans: a. 不安的；不安稳的；不稳定的；矛盾的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: unlike
trans: prep. 不像；与......不问a. 不问的

sentences.english: They are both teachers. Otherwise they are quite unlike.
sentences.chinese: 他们两位都是教师；除此之外他们迥然不同。

sentences.english: Music is quite unlike any other art form.
sentences.chinese: 音乐与其他艺术形式迥然不同。

detailed_translations.english: not alike
completely different from a particular person or thing

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: passive
trans: a. 被动的；消极的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: patient
trans: n. 病人，患者a. 有耐心的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉；感官；意义；见识vt. 感觉到

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: sensitive
trans: a. 敏感的；灵敏的；体贴的，体恤的

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: nonsense
trans: n. 谬论；胡言乱语；冒失；毫无意义的话

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: present
trans: a. 当前的n. 礼物；［the"］目前vt. 展现；提出

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；描绘；体现

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: representative
trans: a. 有代表性的，典型的；代议制的n. 代表

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: sentiment
trans: n. 情绪；观点；眷恋

sentences.english: the spread of nationalist sentiments
sentences.chinese: 民族主义情绪的传播

sentences.english: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

name: resent
trans: vt. 怨恨；憎恶

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

name: architecture
trans: n. 建筑设计；建筑学；结构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: detect
trans: vt. 发现，察觉；探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: award
trans: n. 奖品；奖金；加薪vt. 授予

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: reward
trans: n. 报酬，回报；奖励vt. 奖励

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: regarding
trans: prep. 关于

sentences.english: Regarding your recent inquiry, I have enclosed a copy of our new brochure.
sentences.chinese: 关于你最近的咨询，我随信附上一本我们最新的手册。

detailed_translations.english: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about

name: plenty
trans: pron.   /ad. 大量n. 充裕

sentences.english: There’s plenty to do and see in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约有很多事可做，很多东西可看。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough

name: underestimate
trans: vt. 低估；轻视n. 低估

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历；经受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: undermine
trans: vt. 逐渐削弱；损害，破坏

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: undergraduate
trans: n. 本科生

sentences.english: second-year undergraduates
sentences.chinese: 大学二年级学生

detailed_translations.english: a student at college or university, who is working for their first degree

name: occur
trans: vi. 发生；出现；存在；（想法、主意在某人脑海中）突然出现

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: current
trans: a. 现在的，当前的；流行的n. 水流；电流

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: secure
trans: a. 安全的；稳定的；牢固的【僻】v. 获得，实现

sentences.english: There are no secure jobs these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。

sentences.english: We want a secure future for our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。

sentences.english: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

name: security
trans: n. 安全（工作）；安全感；担保

sentences.english: The trial was held under tight security .
sentences.chinese: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。

sentences.english: lax security at airline check-in desks
sentences.chinese: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施

sentences.english: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
sentences.chinese: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动

sentences.english: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后，该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。

sentences.english: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
sentences.chinese: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。

sentences.english: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
sentences.chinese: 出于安全考虑，我们被要求守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。

sentences.english: The thief was caught on a security camera .
sentences.chinese: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。

sentences.english: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。

sentences.english: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
sentences.chinese: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

detailed_translations.english: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime

name: curious
trans: a. 好奇的；稀奇古怪的

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: curiosity
trans: n. 好奇心；珍品

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

name: annual
trans: a. 每年的，年度的n. 年刊

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: visual
trans: a. 视觉的n.  ［C-常用pl.］视觉资料；（电影、录像等的）画面

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: unusual
trans: a. 不寻常的；与众不同的

sentences.english: an unusual feature
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的特点

sentences.english: unusual circumstances
sentences.chinese: 异常状况

sentences.english: It’s unusual for Dave to be late.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫迟到是很少见的。

sentences.english: (= it is quite common ) to feel very angry in a situation like this.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这样的情况觉得非常生气是很正常的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不平常的， 少有的； 独特的， 与众不同的
detailed_translations.english: different from what is usual or normal

name: individual
trans: n. 个人a. 个人的；单独的；独特的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: casual
trans: a. 随便的；不经意的；偶然的；临时的

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: medium
trans: n.  （pl.）媒介；方法a. 中等的

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

name: maximum
trans: n. 最大限度；最大量a. 最大极限的；最高的

sentences.english: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。

sentences.english: They made maximum use of the resources available.
sentences.chinese: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。

sentences.english: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
sentences.chinese: 要想获得最佳的效果，这些运动要做得慢一点。

sentences.english: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
sentences.chinese: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。

sentences.english: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

sentences.english: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元，一次性给付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最大的； 最高的； 顶点的
detailed_translations.english: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

name: modify
trans: vt. 调整；修改；缓和

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: verify
trans: vt. 核实；证实，证明

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

name: exemplify
trans: vt. 举例说明；是......的典型

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；参加比赛

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: common
trans: a. 共同的；普遍的，常见的n. 公共用地

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: combine
trans: v. （使）结合n. 集团

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
