sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

name: mere
trans: a. 仅仅的；只不过；微不足道的

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

sentences.chinese: 把番茄切成片。

name: drama
trans: n. 戏剧；戏，剧；戏剧性情节

sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: cunning
trans: a. 狡猾的；巧妙的n. 坏主意

sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: sheer
trans: a. （用来强调事物的大小、程度或数量）；纯粹的；陡峭的

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

trans: n. 提示；暗示

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

trans: a. 活着的；起居的n. 生活方式；生计

sentences.chinese: 他是仍然健在的最伟大的作曲家之一。

sentences.english: The sun affects all living things (= people, animals, and plants ).
sentences.chinese: 太阳与一切生物息息相关。

sentences.english: a living language
sentences.chinese: 活语言，仍在使用的语言

sentences.english: It’s not a great job, but it’s a living.
sentences.chinese: 这不是什么了不起的工作，不过是一种生计。

detailed_translations.english: alive now

trans: n. 价值;优点；［C-常用pl.］长处vt. 值得

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

trans: a. 巨大的；厚重的；非常严重的

sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

trans: n. 意义，意思；含义

sentences.english: What’s the meaning of this? I asked you to be here an hour ago!
sentences.chinese: 这是什么意思？我让你一小时之前就要到的！

trans: ad. 非常；高度地；赞赏地

sentences.chinese: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

sentences.chinese: 宜居的街区

sentences.chinese: 艾略特极有影响力的诗作《荒原》

sentences.chinese: 高度发达的经济

detailed_translations.english: very

sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: lower
trans: v. 降低a. 下面的

sentences.english: Temperatures will be lower over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 周末气温会下降。

sentences.english: She lowered her newspaper and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她放低报纸往四下看了看。

detailed_translations.english: smaller in number or amount
to let or make sth/sb go down

name: zone
trans: n. 地区，地带，区域

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

name: master
trans: n. 主人；大师vt. 掌握，精通；控制a. 精通的

sentences.english: a work of art by a true master
sentences.chinese: 一件真正的大师之作

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: Master of Arts/Science/Education etc
sentences.chinese: 文学/理学/教育学等硕士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very skilled at something

name: struggle
trans: vi. 努力；斗争n. 斗争

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；等级

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

name: poverty
trans: n. 贫穷，贫困；贫乏

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: scheme
trans: n. 计划，方案v. 密谋

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: score
trans: n. 得分；分数，成绩；［pl］大量

sentences.english: At half-time the score was one all.
sentences.chinese: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.english: What’s the score?
sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.chinese: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.english: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.chinese: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

name: doubt
trans: n. 疑问；怀疑vt .怀疑

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: bonus
trans: n. 奖金；红利；额外的好处

sentences.english: Long-term savers qualify for a cash bonus.
sentences.chinese: 长期储户可获现金红利。

sentences.english: Further additions to your pay may take the form of bonus payments.
sentences.chinese: 工资以外的钱可能以奖金的形式发放。

sentences.english: a Christmas bonus
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节奖金

sentences.english: Each worker receives an annual bonus.
sentences.chinese: 每个员工都可获得一笔年度奖金。

sentences.english: a £20,000 bonus
sentences.chinese: 一笔2万英镑的奖金

detailed_translations.english: money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work

name: tag
trans: n. 标签vt. 给......加上标签；把......称作

sentences.english: You just search for an artist, song, album , or just a random search tag.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要搜索艺术家、歌曲、相册、或者仅仅是一个随机搜索标签。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
to attach a tag to something

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；列举；表彰；传讯

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: census
trans: n. 人口普查

sentences.english: He and Mary journeyed to Bethlehem to be counted in the Roman census, and while they were there the child was born.
sentences.chinese: 他和玛利亚一起去到伯利恒，罗马的人口普查把他们统计在内。 他们在那里时，孩子降生了。

detailed_translations.english: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

name: source
trans: n. 来源；根源；［C-常用pl.］消息来源

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: regret
trans: vt. 后悔；对......感到遗憾n. 懊悔；遗憾

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: rural
trans: a. 乡村的，农村的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式；惯例a. 仪式上的

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: fabric
trans: n. 织物；（社会、机构等的）结构

sentences.english: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
sentences.chinese: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

sentences.english: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
sentences.chinese: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

detailed_translations.english: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

name: murder
trans: n.  /vt. 谋杀

sentences.english: On the night the murder was committed , he was out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 凶案发生当晚他不在国内。

sentences.english: The man accused of her murder will appear in court today.
sentences.chinese: 被指控谋杀她的那名男子将于今天出庭。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of attempted murder.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀未遂。

sentences.english: She was charged with two counts of first degree murder.
sentences.chinese: 她被控犯有两项一级谋杀罪。

sentences.english: The mother of the murder victim wept in court.
sentences.chinese: 凶案死者的母亲在法庭上痛哭。

sentences.english: Police are searching for the murder weapon.
sentences.chinese: 警方在寻找杀人凶器。

sentences.english: He was convicted of murdering a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀一名警察的罪名成立。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of deliberately killing someone
to kill someone deliberately and illegally

name: lucky
trans: a. 幸运的

sentences.english: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess.
sentences.chinese: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。

sentences.english: a lucky charm
sentences.chinese: 吉祥符

detailed_translations.english: having good luck

name: patent
trans: n. 专利a. 专利的

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: documentary
trans: a. 文件的；文献的；纪实的n. 纪录片

sentences.english: One of the most useful sources of documentary evidence is maps.
sentences.chinese: 最有价值的文献证据之一就是地图。

sentences.english: ...a TV documentary on homelessness.
sentences.chinese: …一部关于无家可归现象的电视记录片。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of or written on documents
a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

name: foremost
trans: a. 最重要的；最著名的；最前的ad. 首先

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: regime
trans: n. 政权；统治；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: anecdote
trans: n. 趣闻，轶事；传闻

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: mortgage
trans: n. 抵押贷款vt. 抵押

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: synthetic
trans: a. 合成的；人造的

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

name: civil
trans: a. 公民的；民用的；政府的；文明的|

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文明社会

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: quota
trans: n. 限额；配额；指标

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: immense
trans: a. 极大的；巨大鬲

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: dimension
trans: n. 维度；方面；尺寸；［常用pl.］范围

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: phrase
trans: n. 短语；警句

sentences.english: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

name: alliance
trans: n. 联盟，结盟

sentences.english: independent organizations and alliances
sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

name: liable
trans: a. 负法律责任的；可能（做某事）；有......倾向的

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: liability
trans: n. 责任；义务；［C-常用pl.］债务

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

name: evident
trans: a. 明显的；清楚的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: invisible
trans: a. 隐形的；无形的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: definition
trans: n. 释义；定义

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

name: deliberate
trans: v. 仔细考虑a. 故意的

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: delight
trans: n. 高兴；愉快vt. 使高兴

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: declare
trans: vt. 宣布

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: declaration
trans: n. 公告；宣告；宣言；声明；申报（单）

sentences.english: to issue/sign a declaration
sentences.chinese: 发布 / 签署公告

sentences.english: the declaration of war
sentences.chinese: 宣战

sentences.english: the Declaration of Independence (= of the United States)
sentences.chinese: （美国）独立宣言

detailed_translations.english: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement

name: alternative
trans: n. 可供选择的事物a. 可供替代的；非传统的；其他的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: leisure
trans: n. 空闲；休闲

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

name: license
trans: n. 许可证，执照vt. 批准

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: transplant
trans: vt. 移植；使迁移n. 移植；移植器官

sentences.english: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
sentences.chinese: 移植肾脏的手术如今相当常见。

detailed_translations.english: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

detailed_translations.chinese: 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者
detailed_translations.english: the operation of transplanting an organ, piece of skin etc

name: transient
trans: a. 短暂的；流动性的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: succeed
trans: vi. 成功；继承vt. 接替

sentences.english: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性，而且差一点就成功了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you tried or wanted to do
to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else

name: succession
trans: n.  一系列；连续；继承权；继任

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

name: successive
trans: a. 连续的；相继的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: suspicious
trans: a. 怀疑的；可疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: tension
trans: n. 紧张；［C-常用pl.］紧张局势

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: extension
trans: n. 延期；延伸

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: tentative
trans: a. 试探性的；暂定的

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: intention
trans: n. 意图，目的

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: servant
trans: n. 仆人；雇员，职员

sentences.english: Many young girls became domestic servants .
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻姑娘成了家仆。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially in the past, who was paid to clean someone’s house, cook for them, answer the door etc, and who often lived in the house

name: reserve
trans: vt. 保留；预订n.  ［c-常用pl.］储备（量）；自然保护区

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: characterize
trans: vt. 是......的特征；描绘

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: likelihood
trans: n. 可能性

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

name: theoretical
trans: a. 理论的；理论上的

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

name: skeptical
trans: a. 怀疑的

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

name: identical
trans: a. 相同的，完全同样的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: empirical
trans: a. 经验主义的；实证的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: electrical
trans: a. 电的；用电的

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: recycle
trans: vt. 回收利用；重新使用（概念、方法、玩笑等）

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 再现v. 繁殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: reluctant
trans: a. 不情愿的，勉强的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: revive
trans: v. （使）恢复；（使）苏醒

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: revolutionary
trans: a. 革命的；突破性的n. 革命者

sentences.english: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

detailed_translations.english: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

name: renaissance
trans: n. 复兴；文艺复兴

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: republican
trans: a. 共和党的n. 共和党人

sentences.english: Lower taxes made Republican voters happier with their party.
sentences.chinese: 更低的税率使共和党选民对该党更加满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 共和国的；共和政体的；共和主义的；拥护共和政体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or supporting a system of government that is not led by a king or queen
someone who believes in government by elected representatives only, with no king or queen

name: remote
trans: a. 偏远的；遥远的；远亲的；微小的；相差很大的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: repel
trans: vt. 击退；驱除；使厌恶v. 排斥

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。

detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

name: nutrition
trans: n. 营养

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: objection
trans: n. 反对；异议

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: precision
trans: n. 精确，准确

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: automation
trans: n. 自动化

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

name: surgery
trans: n. 外科手术；诊室

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: lottery
trans: n. 彩票抽奖；碰运气的事

sentences.english: a lottery ticket
sentences.chinese: 彩票

sentences.english: Do you really think winning the lottery would make you happy?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为彩票中奖会带给你幸福吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法
detailed_translations.english: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作，协作；通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: decorate
trans: vt. 装饰；授予......勋章

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

name: migrate
trans: vi. 迁徙；移居

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: emigrate
trans: vi. 移居国外；移民

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: designate
trans: vt. 命名；指定；指派

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: integrate
trans: v. （使）合并；（使）融入

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: vulnerable
trans: a. 易受伤害的；脆弱的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: favorable
trans: a. 有利的；肯定的，赞同的；优惠的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: collapse
trans: vi. 倒塌；晕倒；崩溃n. 崩溃；塌陷

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: compose
trans: v. 创作vt. 构成；撰写

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

name: competent
trans: a. 足以胜任的；有能力的；称职的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: comprise
trans: vt. 包含；由……组成；是（某事物的）组成部分

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: consult
trans: v. 商议，商量；咨询

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: concentrate
trans: v. 集中vi. 专心，专注

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: consume
trans: vt. 消耗；消费；吃；喝

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: construct
trans: vt. 建造；构筑；创建；绘制【僻】n. 观念

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: convert
trans: v. （使）转变，（使）转换

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

name: confident
trans: a. 自信的；有信心的；肯定的，确信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: conservative
trans: a. 保守的；［C-］保守党的

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: correlate
trans: v. （使）相互关联

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: corrupt
trans: a. 腐败的，贪污的；堕落的vt. 使堕落；使腐化

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

name: pioneer
trans: n. 先锋，先驱vt. 倡导

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: direct
trans: a. 直接的；直率的vt. 把......对准；管理

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: direction
trans: n. 方向；趋势

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: director
trans: n. 董事；经理；导演

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: premise
trans: n. 前提；假定

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: prestige
trans: n. 声望；威信a. 受尊重的

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: preface
trans: n. 前口，序口 vt. 为......写序《

sentences.english: ...the preface to Kelman's novel.
sentences.chinese: …凯尔曼小说的前言。

sentences.english: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 我将引用莎士比亚的几行诗作为我讲话的开场白。

detailed_translations.english: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

name: pregnant
trans: a. 怀孕的；饱含

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: vain
trans: a. 徒劳的；自负的

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

name: beneficial
trans: a. 有益的，有利的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: manifest
trans: vt. 显现a. 明显的

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: upright
trans: a. 直立的；垂直的；正直的

sentences.english: Katie was still awake, sitting bolt upright(= sitting with her back very straight ) staring at the television.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂还醒着，坐得笔直，眼睛盯着电视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正直的，诚实的；垂直的，直立的；笔直的；合乎正道的
detailed_translations.english: standing or sitting straight up
a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something

name: upper
trans: a. 上面的；较高的n. ［常用pl.］鞋帮

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: grieve
trans: v. 悲伤，伤心

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

name: coincide
trans: vi. 同时发生；一致；重叠

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: cargo
trans: n. （船或飞机装载的）货物

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: criterion
trans: n. 标准

sentences.english: the criteria we use to select candidates
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选候选人的标准

detailed_translations.english: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

name: ecology
trans: n. 生态；生态学

sentences.english: the natural ecology of the Earth
sentences.chinese: 地球的自然生态

sentences.english: plant ecology
sentences.chinese: 植物生态学

detailed_translations.english: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；技工

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: engineering
trans: n. 工程；工程学

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

name: variety
trans: n. 各式各样；多样化；品种，种类

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

name: fierce
trans: a. 凶猛的；激烈的；狂暴的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: conference
trans: n. 会议；研讨会

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: defer
trans: vt. 推迟；延缓vi. 听从

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

name: refer
trans: vi. 参考；查阅；提到;称......（为）

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: infer
trans: vt. 推断；推理

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: preferable
trans: a. 更好的；更合心意的；更可取的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: differ
trans: vi. 相异，有区别；不同于

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: fertilizer
trans: n. 肥料

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: academy
trans: n. 研究院，学会；专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

name: prohibit
trans: vt. 禁止；阻止

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: profession
trans: n. 专业；行业；声明

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: protest
trans: v. （公开）反对，抗议n. 抗议

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: sensible
trans: a. 明智的；合理的；意识到

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

name: consensus
trans: n. 共识，一致的意见

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: consent
trans: n. 同意，准许vi. 同意

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

name: counterpart
trans: n. 职位（或作用）相当的人；对应的事物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: portion
trans: n. 部分；（食物的）一份

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: prone
trans: a. 易于遭受......的；有做（坏事）的倾向；俯卧的

sentences.english: His eyes shifted to the prone body on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他的视线移向了趴在地上的尸体。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于…的， 很有可能…的； 俯卧的
detailed_translations.english: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful

name: permit
trans: n. 许可证vt. 允许，准许；使有可能

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服；劝说；使相信

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: proceed
trans: vi. 继续进行；继续做；前往n.  ［pl.］收益

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: cease
trans: v. 停止

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

name: dealer
trans: n. 商人，交易商

sentences.english: ...an antique dealer.
sentences.chinese: …一位古董商。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells a particular product, especially an expensive one

name: practitioner
trans: n. （尤指医学或法律界的）从业人员；专门人才

sentences.english: RMC provides structure in three areas for the practitioner: productivity, guidance , and personalization.
sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.english: The dictionary is mainly for civil aviation practitioner, aviation majored students and Aviation enthusiasts.
sentences.chinese: 词典主要面向民航从业人员、航空专业学员以及航空爱好者。

sentences.english: The articulation of work and life, cast as work-life balance, has become a key feature of much current government, practitioner and academic debate.
sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

name: charter
trans: n. 宪章，章程；特许状vt. 包租

sentences.english: ...the last charter plane carrying out foreign nationals.
sentences.chinese: …运出外国侨民的最后一班包机。

detailed_translations.english: A charter plane or boat is one which is rented for use by a particular person or group and which is not part of a regular service

detailed_translations.chinese: 宪章，共同纲领；特许状，许可证；包租
detailed_translations.english: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization
to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc

name: incur
trans: vt. 招致；遭受；引起

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: curriculum
trans: n.  （pl.）全部课程

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning
sentences.chinese: 课程安排

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

name: currency
trans: n. 货币；通用

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: accuracy
trans: n. 准确（性）

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: simple
trans: a. 简单的；朴素的

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

name: explicit
trans: a. 明确的；清楚明白的；直言的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: compliment
trans: n. 称赞；［pl.］致意vt. 称赞

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: abandon
trans: vt. 放弃；中止；陷入

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: aware
trans: a. 意识到；知道

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: accuse
trans: vt. 指控；控告；谴责

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: accumulate
trans: vt. 积累；积聚vi. 堆积；聚集

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: admire
trans: vt. 钦佩；欣赏

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: adapt
trans: v. （使）适应vi. 改编

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: adjective
trans: n. 形容词

sentences.english: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.chinese: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.english: The "me" circuit hummed not only when they thought whether a particular adjective described themselves, but also when they considered whether it described their mother.
sentences.chinese: “我”神经回路不仅当他们想到一个特定形容词是否描述自我时接通，而且当他们思考该词是否形容自己母亲时也同样。

sentences.english: Using phrases like “Darwinian selection” or “Darwinian evolution” implies there must be another kind of evolution at work, a process that can be described with another adjective.
sentences.chinese: 使用“达尔文选择”或“达尔文进化论”这样的短语意味着工作中必须有另一种进化形式，一种可以用另一个形容词来描述的过程。

detailed_translations.english: a word that describes a noun or  pronoun  . In the phrase ‘black hat’, ‘black’ is an adjective and in the sentence ‘It makes her happy’, ‘happy’ is an adjective.

name: application
trans: n. 申请；应用

sentences.english: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。

sentences.english: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.english: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 月底之前必须递交申请。

sentences.english: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.english: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.english: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

sentences.english: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
sentences.chinese: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你的申请信昨天收悉，谢谢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 申请， 申请书； 施用， 涂抹； 应用， 实施； 实用性
detailed_translations.english: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

name: assign
trans: vt. 分配；转让

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: attach
trans: vt. 贴上；重视；缠着

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: attain
trans: vt. 达到；获得

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

name: spacious
trans: a. 宽敞的；广阔的

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: ambiguous
trans: a. 模棱两可的；含糊不清的

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: domain
trans: n. 领域；领土；范围

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: kingdom
trans: n. 王国

sentences.english: the United Kingdom
sentences.chinese: 联合王国

sentences.english: the animal/plant/mineral kingdom
sentences.chinese: 动物界/植物界/矿物界〔大自然三界〕

detailed_translations.english: a country ruled by a king or queen

name: evoke
trans: vt. 唤起（感情、记忆或形象）；引起

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: endeavor
trans: n.  /vt. 努力

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够；使成为可能

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: exploit
trans: vt. 开发；利用；剥削

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: exempt
trans: a. 免除（责任、付款等）vt. 免除

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: expend
trans: vt. 花费；耗费.

sentences.english: Children expend a lot of energy and may need more high-energy food than adults.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们耗能多，可能比成人需要更多高能量的食物。

detailed_translations.english: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

name: enroll
trans: v. （使）加入；登记；招收

sentences.english: You need to enroll before the end of August.
sentences.chinese: 你必须在八月底前注册。

detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this

name: setback
trans: n. 挫折；阻碍

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

name: comparable
trans: a. 类似的；可比较的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: comparative
trans: a. 比较的；相对的；比较级的

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: surge
trans: vi. 飞涨；涌n. 急剧上升；汹涌

sentences.english: a device that protects your computer against electrical surges
sentences.chinese: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌
detailed_translations.english: a sudden quick movement of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc through something
if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

name: commute
trans: vi. 通勤，上下班往返vt. 减刑n. 通勤的路程

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: mutual
trans: a. 相互的；彼此的；共同的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: spirit
trans: n. 精神；意志

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

name: spiritual
trans: a. 精神的；心灵的；宗教的

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

name: bypass
trans: n. 旁道；（心脏）搭桥手术vt. 绕开

sentences.english: a triple bypass operation
sentences.chinese: 接三通管的手术

sentences.english: Interstate 8 bypasses the town to the north.
sentences.chinese: 八号州际公路绕城向北而行。

detailed_translations.english: a tube that allows gas or liquid to flow around something rather than through it
to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it

name: phase
trans: n. 阶段；时期vt. 逐步做

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: formula
trans: n. 公式；配方；方案

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

name: organ
trans: n. 器官；机关；风琴

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: underlie
trans: vt. 构成......的基础；是......的原因

sentences.english: the one basic principle that underlies all of the party’s policies
sentences.chinese: 贯穿该党各项政策的那一条基本原则

detailed_translations.english: to be the cause of something, or be the basic thing from which something develops

name: undertake
trans: vt. 承担；从事；承诺

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: index
trans: n. 索引；指数vt. 为……编索引

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

name: indicate
trans: v. 表明vt. 暗示；指出

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: dedicate
trans: vt. 献（身）；致力于；献给；为......举行落成典礼

sentences.english: The actress now dedicates herself to children’s charity work.
sentences.chinese: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

detailed_translations.english: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

name: dictate
trans: v.  口述；发号施令vt. 支配；影响【僻】v. 强行规定，指令

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

name: verdict
trans: n. 裁决，裁定；结论

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: predict
trans: vt. 预测；预报

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: incidence
trans: n. 发生率

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

name: intricate
trans: a. 错综复杂的

sentences.english: intricate patterns
sentences.chinese: 繁复的图案

detailed_translations.chinese: 错综复杂的， 复杂精细的
detailed_translations.english: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。
