detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: inform
trans: vt.  P#知；对......有影响vi. 告发

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: behalf
trans: n. 代表；为了

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: trigger
trans: vt. 触发；引起n. 扳机

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧；悲剧作品；不幸

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: subscribe
trans: vi. 订阅；赞成；定期捐助

sentences.english: My main reason for subscribing to New Scientist is to keep abreast of advances in science.
sentences.chinese: 我订阅《新科学家》的主要原因是要跟上科学的进步。

sentences.english: Each employee may subscribe for up to £2,000 worth of shares.
sentences.chinese: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

sentences.english: The tour of Edinburgh is fully subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 去爱丁堡旅游的名额已经满了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service

name: prescribe
trans: vt. 开（药、处方）；规定

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: prescription
trans: n. 处方；对策

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: manuscript
trans: n. 手稿；原稿；手抄本

sentences.english: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: a book or piece of writing before it is printed

name: correspond
trans: vi. 相一致；相当于；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: sponsor
trans: n. 赞助商；倡导者vt. 赞助；促成

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: triumph
trans: n. 巨大成功；喜悦；楷模vi. 战胜

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: distribute
trans: vt. 分发；分配；分销；分布；撒，播

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 免职；解雇；解散；消除；不予考虑；驳回

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: youngster
trans: n. 年轻人

sentences.english: Other youngsters are not so lucky.
sentences.chinese: 其他的年轻人没有这么幸运。

detailed_translations.english: a child or young person

name: journalist
trans: n. 新闻记者

sentences.english: a well-known journalist and broadcaster
sentences.chinese: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: assemble
trans: v. 聚集；收集；集合vt. 装配

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembly
trans: n. 议会；集会；装配

sentences.english: Police have imposed conditions on public assemblies.
sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: resemble
trans: vt. 类似；像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: simplicity
trans: n. 简单；朴素

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

name: paradise
trans: n. 天堂

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: parachute
trans: n. 降落伞vi. 跳伞v. （使）空降

sentences.english: a parachute jump
sentences.chinese: 跳伞

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment fastened to the back of people who jump out of planes, which makes them fall slowly and safely to the ground
to jump from a plane using a parachute

name: specialize
trans: vi. 专门研究；专攻

sentences.english: "I think the feedback can be helpful because we all have blinders on when we fall in love, " says Eva Ritvo, a Miami psychiatrist who specialize sin marriage and family therapy.
sentences.chinese: 专门从事婚姻与家庭疗法研究的迈阿密精神病专家瑞塔沃说：“我认为信息回馈是有用的，因为人们在恋爱时都会变得盲目。

sentences.english: The research work is being done by a small group of dedicated and imaginative scientists who specialize in extracting from various sea animals substances that may improve the health of the human race.
sentences.chinese: 一小部分富有想像力和敬业精神的科学家正在进行这项研究，他们专门研究从各种海洋动物中提取能增进人类健康的物质。

detailed_translations.english: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应特殊目的， 使专用于

name: unexpected
trans: a. 出乎意料的；突然的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: specify
trans: vt. 具体说明；具体指定；明确规定；详列

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

name: recipient
trans: n. 接受者；领受人

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: occupy
trans: vt. 占用；占领；占据；任职【僻】v. 使忙于（做某事）

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: susceptible
trans: a. 易受影响的；感情丰富的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: reception
trans: n. 接待处；接收（效果）；招待会；反应

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: momentum
trans: n. 动力；势头

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: visible
trans: a. 看得见的；明显的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: classify
trans: vt. 把......分类

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: signify
trans: vt. 表示，表明；意味着

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: qualify
trans: vt. 使合格；使具备资格vi. 取得资格；达标

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: remind
trans: vt. 提醒，使想起

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: mention
trans: vt. 提到n. 提及

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: entertainment
trans: n. 娱乐活动；招待

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

name: assignment
trans: n. 作业；任务；分配

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: penalty
trans: n. 惩罚，处罚；刑罚

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: commodity
trans: n. 商品；有用的东西

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: facility
trans: n. 设备，设施；才能

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: superiority
trans: n. 优势；优越感

sentences.english: the intellectual superiority of humans over other animals
sentences.chinese: 人类相比其他动物所具有的智力优势

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

name: solidarity
trans: n. 团结；相互支持

sentences.english: a gesture of solidarity
sentences.chinese: 团结的表示

sentences.english: an appeal for worker solidarity
sentences.chinese: 呼吁工人们团结

detailed_translations.english: loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim

name: indignation
trans: n. 愤怒

sentences.english: To his indignation, Charles found that his name was not on the list.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯发现他的名字没有出现在名单上，这让他深感愤慨。

sentences.english: He stormed into her office, full of righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他义愤填膺，气呼呼地冲进她的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: feelings of anger and surprise because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: limitation
trans: n. 限制；［C-常用pl.］局限

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

name: obligation
trans: n. 责任，义务

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: textile
trans: n. 纺织品

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

name: juvenile
trans: a. 少年的；幼稚的n. 少年

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

name: extravagant
trans: a. 奢侈的；过于昂贵的；过分的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: consultant
trans: n. 顾问

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 管理顾问

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

name: rational
trans: a. 理性的；理智的；合理的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: trivial
trans: a. 琐碎的；不重要的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: neutral
trans: a. 中立的；中性的n. 中立者

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.english: the neutral language of an official news report
sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: controversial
trans: a. 有争议的，引起争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: colonial
trans: a. 殖民的

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.english: Britain was the largest colonial power .
sentences.chinese: 英国曾是最大的殖民强国。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

name: disposal
trans: n. 处理；清理

sentences.english: bomb disposal experts
sentences.chinese: 拆弹专家

detailed_translations.english: when you get rid of something

name: moreover
trans: ad,此外;而且

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: nowhere
trans: ad. 没有任何地方；任何其他地方都不

sentences.english: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

detailed_translations.english: not in any place or to any place

name: framework
trans: n. 框架；（体系的）结构，机制

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

name: housework
trans: n. 家务事，家务劳动

sentences.english: Men are doing more housework nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现今男人正在承担越来越多的家务。

detailed_translations.english: work that you do to take care of a house, for example washing, cleaning etc

name: software
trans: n. 软件

sentences.english: She loaded the new software .
sentences.chinese: 她给电脑装上新的软件。

sentences.english: a software company
sentences.chinese: 软件公司

detailed_translations.english: the sets of programs that tell a computer how to do a particular job

name: spacecraft
trans: n.  （pl.）宇宙飞船；航天器

sentences.english: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

name: aircraft
trans: n.  （pl.）飞机；航空器

sentences.english: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的返回航程被推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: a plane or other vehicle that can fly

name: widespread
trans: a. 广泛的；普遍的

sentences.english: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；反馈的意见（或信息）

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: database
trans: n. 数据库

sentences.english: customer details held on a database
sentences.chinese: 存储在数据库内的客户详细信息

detailed_translations.english: a large amount of data stored in a computer system so that you can find and use it easily

name: offspring
trans: n.  （pl.）子女；子孙；后代；产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: turnover
trans: n. 人事变更率；营业额

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

name: straightforward
trans: a. 简单的，易懂的；坦率的

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: throughout
trans: prep. 贯穿；遍及ad. 自始至终

sentences.english: a large organization with offices throughout the world
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构

sentences.english: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。

sentences.english: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。

sentences.english: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。

detailed_translations.english: in every part of a particular area, place etc
during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

name: worthwhile
trans: a. 值得花时间（或花钱、努力等）；有价值的

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

name: thereby
trans: ad. 因此；从而

sentences.english: Our bodies can sweat, thereby losing heat by evaporation.
sentences.chinese: 我们的身体会流汗，由此能通过蒸发散热。

detailed_translations.english: with the result that something else happens

name: meanwhile
trans: ad. 同时，与此同时；在此期间

sentences.english: Cook the sauce over a medium heat until it thickens. Meanwhile start boiling the water for the pasta.
sentences.chinese: 用中火把调味汁煮到变稠，同时烧水准备煮意大利面。

detailed_translations.english: while something else is happening

name: highlight
trans: vt. 突出；强调；标出n. 最精彩的部分

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: hitherto
trans: ad,迄今，到目前为止

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

name: habitat
trans: n. 生活环境；栖息地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: acute
trans: a. 严重的；剧烈的；急性的；敏锐的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: boost
trans: vt. 促进；使增长n. 激励；增长

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: lag
trans: vi. 落后，滞后n. 滞后；时间间隔

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

name: stream
trans: n. 溪流；一连串；（车或人）流vi. 流动【僻】n. 一股

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

name: arrival
trans: n. 到来倒达；至!J达者

sentences.english: Only the timely arrival of the police prevented the situation from becoming worse.
sentences.chinese: 警方及时赶到才阻止了事态恶化。

sentences.english: Traffic problems account for one third of late arrivals.
sentences.chinese: 迟到的人有三分之一是因为交通问题。

sentences.english: The first arrivals at the concert got the best seats.
sentences.chinese: 最早来到音乐会的人坐上了最好的座位。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something arrives somewhere

name: annoy
trans: vt. 使生气；使恼怒；骚扰

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: fruitful
trans: a. 成果丰硕的；富有成效的；富饶的

sentences.english: Today’s meeting proved more fruitful than last week’s.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明今天的会议比上星期的更有成效。

sentences.english: a busy and fruitful time
sentences.chinese: 忙碌而有成效的一段时间

sentences.english: a fruitful source of information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息来源

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有成效的；多产的；果实结得多的
detailed_translations.english: producing good results

name: realm
trans: n. 领域；王国

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保修单vt. 保证

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: character
trans: n. 性格；人物；字符；特征

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: channel
trans: n. 频道；海峡；水渠【僻】n. 途径

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: doom
trans: n. 厄运；死亡vt. 注定

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.english: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

name: label
trans: n. 标签vt. 贴标签于；（尤指不公正地）把......称为

sentences.english: a luggage label
sentences.chinese: 行李标签

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
to attach a label onto something or write information on something

name: clone
trans: vt. 克隆n. 克隆动物（或植物）；复制品

sentences.english: The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 对绝种的生命形式进行克隆的想法仍然属于科学幻想。

detailed_translations.english: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

detailed_translations.chinese: 无性繁殖系，克隆；复制品，翻版
detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same

name: lure
trans: vt. 引诱；吸引；诱惑n. 诱惑力；魅力；诱饵

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: staff
trans: n. 全体职工（或雇员）vt. 为......配备职员

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

name: pledge
trans: n. 保证；誓约v. 正式承诺vt. 用......抵押

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: alert
trans: a. 警觉的；机敏的vt. 使意识到n. 警戒；警报

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

name: bill
trans: n. 账单；法案vt. 给......开账单；把......宣传为

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: pave
trans: vt. 铺（路）；铺砌

sentences.english: a paved courtyard
sentences.chinese: 地面铺砌过的院子

detailed_translations.english: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or  concrete

name: mood
trans: n. 情绪；心情；气氛

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；错误见解

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: nasty
trans: a. 不友好的；极差的；严重的

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: pour
trans: vt. 倒，注；倾吐vi. 涌流；大量涌至；倾盆而下

sentences.english: She poured coffee for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

name: poll
trans: n. 民意调查；选举投票vt. 对......进行民意测验；获得（票数）

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: random
trans: a. 随机的；随意的n. 偶然的行动

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: rank
trans: n. 等级；军衔v. 给......排等级

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: swing
trans: v. （使）摇摆，摆动n. 摇摆，摆动；秋千

sentences.english: Let your arms swing as you walk.
sentences.chinese: 边走边摆动双臂。

sentences.english: a sign swinging in the wind
sentences.chinese: 在风中摇摆的指示牌

sentences.english: He was swinging his bag back and forth .
sentences.chinese: 他前后甩动着他的包。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 她左右晃动着两条腿。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 他对准球猛地挥拍一击。

detailed_translations.english: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this
a swinging movement or rhythm

name: bid
trans: n. 出价；投标v. 出价vi. 投标【僻】v. /n. 努力获得

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: boom
trans: n. 激增；繁荣；风靡vi. 繁荣

sentences.english: The boom has created job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

sentences.english: the economic boom of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.english: The economy went from boom to bust (=  from increasing to decreasing  ) very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

detailed_translations.english: a quick increase of business activity

name: bound
trans: a. （与......）密切相关的；一定会；准备前往；受（某事物）约束

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: fuel
trans: n. 燃料vt. 刺激；给......提供燃料

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

name: wage
trans: n. 工资vt. 发动（战争、战斗等）

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name: prey
trans: vi捕食n. 猎物

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: switch
trans: n. 转变；开关v. （使）转变，改变vt. 交换

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: toll
trans: n. 损失；通行费；伤亡人数v. 敲（钟）

sentences.english: Church bells tolled and black flags fluttered.
sentences.chinese: 教堂丧钟敲响了，黑旗飘动着。

detailed_translations.english: if a large bell tolls, or if you toll it, it keeps ringing slowly, especially to show that someone has died

detailed_translations.chinese: 过路费，过桥费；伤亡人数，损失
detailed_translations.english: the number of people killed or injured in a particular accident, by a particular illness etc

name: tough
trans: a. 艰苦的，艰难的；强硬的；坚强的

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: wonder
trans: n. 奇迹；惊奇v. 想知道；感到惊讶

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: cling
trans: vi. 紧附，附着；坚持；抓紧

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: sweep
trans: v. 打扫；席卷n. 打扫

sentences.english: Bert swept the path in front of the house.
sentences.chinese: 伯特清扫了屋前的小路。

sentences.english: Thunderstorms swept the country.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴横扫全国。

detailed_translations.english: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

name: tackle
trans: vt. 处理，解决；与......交涉；抓获

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: splash
trans: vi. 泼洒n. 色块；引人注目的效果

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: stare
trans: vi. 盯着看，凝视n. 凝视

sentences.english: She sat there staring into space (= looking for a long time at nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 她坐在那里，出神地凝视前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描；草图；幽默短剧vt. 概述v. 画素描

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: afraid
trans: a. 害怕；担心

sentences.english: There’s no need to be afraid.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要害怕。

sentences.english: He was afraid that the other kids would laugh at him.
sentences.chinese: 他担心其他孩子会嘲笑他。

detailed_translations.english: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

name: element
trans: n. 要素；元素；少量

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: underlying
trans: a. 潜在的；根本的；在下面的

sentences.english: To stop a problem you have to understand its underlying causes.
sentences.chinese: 要解决问题，你得了解其潜在原因。

detailed_translations.english: The underlying features of an object, event, or situation are not obvious, and it may be difficult to discover or reveal them

name: shelter
trans: n. 避难所；住处；掩蔽vt. 掩蔽；保护vi. 躲避

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: hinder
trans: vt. 阻碍；妨碍

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: grasp
trans: vt. 抓紧；领会n. 紧抓；领悟

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: bargain
trans: vi. 讨价还价；商谈n. 便宜货；交易【僻】n. 协议

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: slip
trans: vi. 滑倒；脱落；溜；陷入n. 纸条；差错

sentences.english: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 本悄悄地溜出了房间。

sentences.english: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
sentences.chinese: 警察到来时，一个男子设法溜出了俱乐部。

sentences.english: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须好好准备，一定不要有差错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑跤，滑落，溜；下降，跌落；悄悄放进
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
A slip is a small or unimportant mistake

name: prose
trans: n. 散文

sentences.english: Shute's prose is stark and chillingly unsentimental.
sentences.chinese: 舒特的散文刻板而冷峻。

detailed_translations.english: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry

name: slight
trans: a. 轻微的；略微的；纤细的

sentences.english: a slight improvement
sentences.chinese: 些许的改进

sentences.english: a slight increase
sentences.chinese: 少许的增加

sentences.english: a slight change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的略微变动

sentences.english: a slight pause
sentences.chinese: 稍稍的停顿

sentences.english: a slight problem
sentences.chinese: 小问题

detailed_translations.english: small in degree
to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

name: border
trans: n. 边界，国界；边饰vt. 和......毗邻

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: horizon
trans: n.  ［the-］地平线；［C-常用pl.］范围；眼界

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: flaw
trans: n. 缺陷；瑕疵；错误；（性格中的）缺点

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: thrive
trans: vi. 茁壮成长；繁荣，蓬勃发展

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: yield
trans: vi. 屈服vt. 缴出；产出n. 产量

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: bureau
trans: n.  （pl.）办事处；局，处，科

sentences.english: an employment bureau
sentences.chinese: 职业介绍所

sentences.english: the Citizens Advice Bureau
sentences.chinese: 公民咨询局

detailed_translations.english: an office or organization that collects or provides information

name: chop
trans: vt. 砍，劈;削减n. 砍,劈

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces

name: confine
trans: vt. 限制；监禁n.  ［pL］界限

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: definite
trans: a. 明确的；明显的；肯定的

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

name: finite
trans: a. 有限的；（语法）限定的

sentences.english: the earth’s finite resources
sentences.chinese: 地球有限的资源

detailed_translations.chinese: 有限的， 有限制的； 限定的
detailed_translations.english: having an end or a limit

name: refine
trans: vt. 精炼；改进；完善

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: possession
trans: n. 占有；拥有；［C-常用pl.］私人物品

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

name: insure
trans: vt. （亦作ensure）确保，保证v. 投保

sentences.english: Have you insured the contents of your home?
sentences.chinese: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

sentences.english: facilities to insure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

name: assure
trans: vt. 使确信；向……保证；弄清；确保

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: assurance
trans: n. 保证；自信

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: analyse
trans: vt. 分析；化验分析

sentences.english: She still needs to analyse the data.
sentences.chinese: 她仍需要分析这些数据。

sentences.english: You need to sit down and analyse why you feel so upset.
sentences.chinese: 你得坐下来想一想自己为什么会那么生气。

sentences.english: Joe had never tried to analyze their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 乔从未试图去理清他们的关系。

detailed_translations.english: to examine the nature or structure of sth, especially by separating it into its parts, in order to understand or explain it

name: analytic
trans: a. 分析的

sentences.english: The boy has an analytic mind.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩有分析的头脑。

sentences.english: He has an analytic mind.
sentences.chinese: 他有一个善于分析的头脑。

sentences.english: Quantity and space both play a role in analytic geometry, differential geometry, and algebraic geometry.
sentences.chinese: 数量和空间在解析几何，微分几何和代数几何中都发挥作用。

detailed_translations.english: Analytic means the same as

name: nerve
trans: n. 神经；［pl.］神经紧张；勇气vt. 使鼓起勇气

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: attendant
trans: n. 随从；服务员a. 伴随的；随之而来的

sentences.english: a cloakroom/parking/museum attendant
sentences.chinese: 衣帽间 / 停车服务员；博物馆接待员

sentences.english: The Prince was followed by his attendants.
sentences.chinese: 王子由其侍从陪同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侍者；（要人的）侍从；（病人的）护理人员
detailed_translations.english: a person whose job is to serve or help people in a public place

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争，争夺；处理

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: pretend
trans: v. 假装a. 假想的

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: foresee
trans: vt. 预料；预见

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: statute
trans: n. 法令，法规；条例

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

name: campus
trans: n. （大学、学院的）校园，校区

sentences.english: a beautiful campus in New England
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰的一个美丽校园

detailed_translations.english: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live

name: subordinate
trans: 下级的；从属的n. 下级vt. 使从属于

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: acclaim
trans: vt. 称赞n. 称誉，高度评价

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: exclaim
trans: v. 呼喊；惊叫

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: proclaim
trans: vt. 宣布，公布；表明

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: descent
trans: n. 下降，降落；下坡；血统

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: outset
trans: n. 开始，开端

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: outrage
trans: n. 愤怒，愤慨；暴行vt. 激怒

sentences.english: The response to the jury’s verdict was one of outrage.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团的裁决引发了愤慨。

sentences.english: a sense of moral outrage
sentences.chinese: 一种义愤填膺的感觉

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great anger and shock

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌辱，强奸；对…施暴行；激起愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very angry and shocked

name: panorama
trans: n. 全景；全貌

sentences.english: Horton looked out over a panorama of fertile valleys and gentle hills.
sentences.chinese: 霍顿眺望着那一片肥沃山谷和平缓山脉的景象。

sentences.english: a panorama of life in England 400 years ago
sentences.chinese: 400年前英格兰生活的全景图

detailed_translations.english: an impressive view of a wide area of land

name: unanimous
trans: &一致的；意见一致的

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

name: universe
trans: n.  [the-]宇宙；（已知宇宙以外的）宇宙

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: ignorant
trans: a. 无知的；愚昧的；无礼的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知；愚昧

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: diagnose
trans: vt. 诊断；判断

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: biography
trans: n. 传记；传记文学

sentences.english: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.chinese: …近年的斯大林传记。

detailed_translations.english: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

name: biology
trans: n. 生物学；（生物的）生命机理

sentences.english: a degree in biology
sentences.chinese: 生物学学位

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of living things

name: symposium
trans: n.  (pl.)研讨会

sentences.english: He had been taking part in an international symposium on population.
sentences.chinese: 他那时在参加一个有关人口的国际研讨会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 讨论会,专题报告会；专题论文集
detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting in which people who know a lot about a particular subject have discussions about it

name: synthesis
trans: n.  （pl.）综合；合成

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

name: disturb
trans: vt. 打扰；妨碍；扰乱；弄乱

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: turbulent
trans: a. 动荡的；混乱的；汹涌的；骚动的

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: interim
trans: a. 暂时的，临时的；过渡的

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: maneuver
trans: n. 策略v. 操纵

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

detailed_translations.english: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵；控制；操作

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: manual
trans: a. 手工的；体力的n. 使用手册；指南/

sentences.english: People in manual occupations have a lower life expectancy.
sentences.chinese: 干体力活的人预期寿命较短。

detailed_translations.english: manual work involves using your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind
a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine

name: manufacture
trans: vt. 大量生产；捏造n.  [pl.]工业品；大量制造【僻】v编造（虚假情况、借口等）

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: sue
trans: v. 控告，提起诉讼vi. （在法庭上）提出请求

sentences.english: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
sentences.chinese: 如果建筑商不履行合同，我们就要提出起诉。

sentences.english: The company is suing a former employee.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正在起诉一名前雇员。

sentences.english: The railway may sue for damages (= in order to get money ) because of loss of revenue.
sentences.chinese: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉，要求赔偿。

sentences.english: He is being sued for divorce (= in order to end a marriage ) by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子对他提出起诉，要求离婚。

detailed_translations.english: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sue)人名；(日)末(名)；(法)休；(英)休(女子教名Susan、Susanna的昵称)

name: sequence
trans: n. 次序，顺序；一系列

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: prosecute
trans: v. 起诉vt. 继续从事

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

name: counsel
trans: vt. 建议n. 建议；法律顾问

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

name: insult
trans: vt. 侮辱n. 侮辱，辱骂

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

name: assault
trans: n. /vt. 攻击；袭击

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: polish
trans: vt. 擦亮;改进

sentences.english: Your essay is good, you just need to polish it a bit.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章不错，只要稍加润色就可以了。

detailed_translations.english: to improve a piece of writing, a speech etc by making slight changes to it before it is completely finished
a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny

name: flourish
trans: vi. 繁荣；茁壮成长vt. 挥舞

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: punish
trans: vt. 处罚，惩罚；惩处

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

name: length
trans: n. 长度；细长的一段

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

name: solve
trans: vt. 解决；解答；破解

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

name: dissolve
trans: vt. 使溶解；解除；解散vi. 溶

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: resolute
trans: a. 坚决的；坚定的；果断的

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: resolution
trans: n. 决心；决议；解决

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: morality
trans: n. 道德

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

name: ruthless
trans: a. 无情的；坚决的

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

name: sociology
trans: n. 社会学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: ideology
trans: n. 思想（体系）；意识形态

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: negligible
trans: a. 微不足道的；可忽略不计的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: flexible
trans: a. 灵活的；有弹性的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: feasible
trans: a. 可行的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: incredible
trans: a. 不可思议的；惊人的；了不起的

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
