sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: weary
trans: a. 疲惫的，疲倦的；厌烦的vi. 失去热情

sentences.english: She found Rachel in the kitchen, looking old and weary.
sentences.chinese: 她发现雷切尔在厨房里，看上去苍老而疲惫。

sentences.english: She sat down with a weary sigh.
sentences.chinese: 她疲倦地叹口气坐了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦的；厌烦的；令人厌烦的
detailed_translations.english: very tired or bored, especially because you have been doing something for a long time
to become very tired, or make someone very tired

name: steady
trans: a. 稳定的;持续的ad. 稳定地vt. 使平静

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: slippery
trans: a. 滑的；狡猾的；棘手的

sentences.english: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
sentences.chinese: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。

sentences.english: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
sentences.chinese: “标准”这一模糊概念

detailed_translations.english: something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or  greasy

name: misery
trans: n. 痛苦；苦难

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: apology
trans: n. 道歉；［C-常用pl.］致歉

sentences.english: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
sentences.chinese: 爱德华今天来不了，他向大家表示歉意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

name: symphony
trans: n. 交响乐，交响曲

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

name: hierarchy
trans: n. 等级制度；统治集团

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

name: sarcastic
trans: a. 嘲讽的；挖苦的

sentences.english: Was she being sarcastic?
sentences.chinese: 她是在嘲讽吗？

detailed_translations.english: saying things that are the opposite of what you mean, in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

name: pessimistic
trans: a. 悲观的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: ethnic
trans: a. 种族的；民族的；具有民族特色的

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: authentic
trans: a. 真实的；真正的；可靠的

sentences.english: an authentic account

sentences.english: the campaign for racial equality
sentences.chinese: 争取种族平等的运动

sentences.english: the need for tolerance and racial harmony
sentences.chinese: 包容与种族融洽的必要性

detailed_translations.english: relating to the relationships between different races of people who now live in the same country or area

name: voyage
trans: n. 航行；航程vi. 航行

sentences.english: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
sentences.chinese: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。

sentences.english: the Titanic’s maiden voyage
sentences.chinese: “泰坦尼克”号的首航

sentences.english: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我不想独自航行。

sentences.english: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
to travel to a place, especially by ship

name: package
trans: n. 包裹；包；一套建议；一揽子交易

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

name: savage
trans: a. 凶猛的，残暴的n. 野蛮人vt. 凶狠地攻击

sentences.english: a savage dog
sentences.chinese: 一条凶猛的狗

sentences.english: a savage murder
sentences.chinese: 凶残的谋杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 野蛮的；残酷的；狂怒的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: very violent or cruel

detailed_translations.chinese: 未开化的人；粗鲁的人；残暴成性的人
detailed_translations.english: a very offensive word for someone who has a simple, traditional way of life
if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly

name: anonymous
trans: a. 不知姓名的；匿名的

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: precious
trans: a. 宝贵的；珍奇的；可贵的

sentences.english: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
sentences.chinese: 运送药品、食品等宝贵物资的飞机

sentences.english: our planet’s precious resources
sentences.chinese: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

detailed_translations.english: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

name: fabulous
trans: a. 极好的；绝妙的；传说中的；巨大的

sentences.english: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
sentences.chinese: 那位公爵的巨额财富

sentences.english: You look fabulous!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.english: a fabulous meal
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

sentences.english: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

name: monotonous
trans: a. 单调乏味的

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

name: rigorous
trans: a. 严格的；细致的

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

name: tremendous
trans: a. 巨大的；了不起的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: numerous
trans: a. 很多的，许多的，众多的

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: poisonous
trans: a. 有毒的；能毒伤人的；充满敌意的

sentences.english: Some mushrooms are extremely poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 一些蘑菇有剧毒。

sentences.english: poisonous gases such as hydrogen sulfide
sentences.chinese: 硫化氢等有毒气体

sentences.english: poisonous substances
sentences.chinese: 有毒物质

sentences.english: She was bitten on the ankle by a poisonous snake .
sentences.chinese: 她被毒蛇咬了脚踝。

detailed_translations.english: containing poison or producing poison

name: mysterious
trans: a. 神秘的；奇怪的；故弄玄虚的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: vicious
trans: a. 恶意的；恶毒的；凶猛危险的；剧烈的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

name: notorious
trans: a. 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

name: amuse
trans: vt. 使娱乐；逗乐

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: arise
trans: vi. 产生；出现，发生；起床；起立

sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: amaze
trans: vt. 使吃惊，使惊愕

sentences.english: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: aspire
trans: vi. 渴望；追求

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: abrupt
trans: a. 突然的；唐突的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: absurd
trans: a. 荒谬的

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴；伴随；为......伴奏

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认；确认收到；（公开）感谢

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: accord
trans: n. 致；协议vi. （与……）致，符合vt. 给予

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
detailed_translations.english: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

name: advisable
trans: a. 可取的；明智的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

name: aggravate
trans: vt. 使恶化；使加重；激怒.

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: applaud
trans: v. 鼓掌vt. 赞许，称赞

sentences.english: The audience applauded loudly.
sentences.chinese: 观众掌声雷动。

sentences.english: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
sentences.chinese: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

name: appoint
trans: vt. 任命；约定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定

name: assert
trans: vt. 断言；坚持自己的主张；维护自己的权利（或权威）

sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: assume
trans: vt. 假定；承担；假装；呈现

sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: abide
trans: vt. 忍受vi. 遵守；居住；停留

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: absent
trans: a. 缺席的；缺乏的；心不在焉的vt. 不在

sentences.chinese: 她脸上呆滞、茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的

to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

name: accountant
trans: n. 会计，会计师

sentences.english: The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: They conferred with the accountant vis-à-vis the proposed budget.
sentences.chinese: 他们与会计商量有关预算提案的事。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc

name: peasant
trans: n. 农民

sentences.english: Most villagers are peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 大多数村民是农民。

detailed_translations.english: a poor farmer who owns or rents a small amount of land, either in past times or in poor countries

name: tolerant
trans: a. 宽容的；容忍的；能耐......的

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: arrogant
trans: a. 傲慢的，自大的

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

name: indignant
trans: a. 愤慨的，愤怒的，义愤的

sentences.english: an indignant reply
sentences.chinese: 愤慨的回复

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒的， 愤慨的， 义愤的
detailed_translations.english: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: predominant
trans: a. 主导的；显著的

sentences.english: the predominant group in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的主导群体

sentences.english: In this painting, the predominant colour is black.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画的主色调是黑色。

detailed_translations.english: more powerful, more common, or more easily noticed than others

name: wrist
trans: n. 手腕

sentences.english: He broke his wrist climbing rocks for a cigarette ad.
sentences.chinese: 他为了一个香烟广告攀岩折断了手腕。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body where your hand joins your arm

name: tribe
trans: n. 部落；（动物或植物的）族；大批（人）

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

name: triple
trans: a. 三倍的；三方的v. 成为三倍

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

name: triangle
trans: n. 三角形；三角关系

sentences.english: Yes, it is like a triangle.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它象一个三角形。

sentences.english: So, we have to find the area of the triangle.
sentences.chinese: 因此我们必须求出三角形的面积。

sentences.english: It can measure not only the sine wave, square wave, triangle wave, a sharp pulse but also can measure other characteristics of the signal wave.
sentences.chinese: 它不仅可以测量正弦波、方波、三角波、尖脉冲信号和其他具有周期特性的信号的频率，而且还可以测量它们的周期。

detailed_translations.english: a flat shape with three straight sides and three angles

name: valid
trans: a. （法律上）有效的；合理的；有根据的

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: invalid
trans: a. 无效的；站不住脚的vt. （因伤病）令......退役

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: inhale
trans: v. 吸入，吸气

sentences.english: It is dangerous to inhale ammonia fumes.
sentences.chinese: 吸入氨气是很危险的。

sentences.english: Myra lit another cigarette and inhaled deeply  (= breathed in a lot of smoke ).
sentences.chinese: 迈拉又点上一支烟，深深地吸了一口。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

name: telegraph
trans: n. 电报v. 打电报vt. 泄露

sentences.english: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
sentences.chinese: 一知道我们在哪里，刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

detailed_translations.english: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
to send a message by telegraph

name: plateau
trans: n.  [Wj原；稳定期vi. 保持稳定水平

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: signature
trans: n. 签名；签字；明显特征

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: discern
trans: vt. 认识；觉察出；辨明

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: verge
trans: vi. 濒于n. 路边

sentences.english: The car skidded across the road and came to a stop on the grass verge.
sentences.chinese: 汽车滑过路面，在路缘草带上停了下来。

sentences.english: His love of James Dean movies verged on fanaticism.
sentences.chinese: 他对詹姆斯·迪恩影片的喜爱近乎狂热。

detailed_translations.english: an edge or rim; margin
to be very close to a harmful or extreme state

name: inhabit
trans: vt. 居住在；栖居于

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

name: inhabitant
trans: n. 居民

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: bureaucracy
trans: n. 官僚主义；官僚作风；官僚体制

sentences.english: the reduction of unnecessary bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 消除不必要的官僚体制

detailed_translations.english: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

name: preside
trans: vi. 主持；负责

sentences.english: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

name: residence
trans: n. 居住；居留许可；住所

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: session
trans: n. 会议；一段时间；一场

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: indicative
trans: a. 表明；陈述的

sentences.english: This behaviour is indicative of her whole attitude, I’m afraid.
sentences.chinese: 这一行为恐怕已表明了她的总体态度。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标示的，指示的，象征的；陈述的
detailed_translations.english: an indicative verb form is used for making statements
the form of a verb that is used to make statements. For example, in the sentences ‘Penny passed her test’, and ‘Michael likes cake’, the verbs ‘passed’ and ‘likes’ are in the indicative.

name: indication
trans: n. 表明；迹象

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: addict
trans: n. 对......入迷的人；吸毒成瘾的人

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: organism
trans: n. 生物；有机体；有机体系

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: mobilize
trans: vt. 调动；调用v. 动员

sentences.english: an attempt to mobilize popular opinion
sentences.chinese: 鼓动公众舆论的尝试

sentences.english: a campaign to mobilize support for the strike
sentences.chinese: 动员大家支持罢工的宣传活动

detailed_translations.english: to encourage people to support something in an active way
to encourage people to support something in an active way

name: verse
trans: n. 诗；韵文；歌曲的段落

sentences.english: Let’s sing the last verse again.
sentences.chinese: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。

sentences.english: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。

sentences.english: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
sentences.chinese: 《创世记》第3章第13节

detailed_translations.english: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran

name: diversion
trans: n. 转移；消遣

sentences.english: ...the illegal diversion of profits from secret arms sales.
sentences.chinese: …销售秘密武器所得收益的非法转移。

sentences.english: The party will make a pleasant diversion.
sentences.chinese: 晚会会是一个很不错的消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

name: adverse
trans: a. 不利的；反面的

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: divorce
trans: n. 离婚；分离v. （与......）离婚

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: divert
trans: vt. 转移；转移（某人的）注意力；使消遣

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: vertical
trans: a. 垂直的；纵向的

sentences.english: a vertical line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: the vertical axis of a graph
sentences.chinese: 图的纵轴

sentences.english: vertical window blinds
sentences.chinese: 垂直百叶窗

sentences.english: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 这堵墙倾斜了有好几度。

detailed_translations.english: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
a vertical line or position

name: avert
trans: vt. 防止，避免；转移（目光等）

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；节律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: distinguish
trans: v. 区分，辨别vt. 听出【僻】v. 使出众

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: extinguish
trans: vt. 扑灭；熄灭；消灭；使破灭J

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: polite
trans: a. 有礼貌的；应酬的；礼节性的；上流的

sentences.english: She’s always very polite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是很有礼貌。

sentences.english: polite, well-behaved children
sentences.chinese: 懂礼貌、守规矩的孩子

sentences.english: a clear but polite request
sentences.chinese: 明确但客气的请求

sentences.english: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

name: metropolitan
trans: a. 大城市的，大都市的

sentences.english: a metropolitan area of South Australia
sentences.chinese: 南澳大利亚的一个都市区

sentences.english: ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教

detailed_translations.english: relating or belonging to a very large city
a metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.

name: politician
trans: n. 政治家

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: disclose
trans: vt. 揭露；泄露；透露；使显露

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: inclusive
trans: a. 包括一切费用在内的；包容广阔的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: conclude
trans: v. （使）结束vt. 推断出；达成（协议）

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: spy
trans: n. 间谍；密探vi. 秘密监视；从事间谍活动

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: conspicuous
trans: a. 显眼的；明显的；引人注目的；惹人注意的

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: despite
trans: prep. 尽管

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

name: spectator
trans: n. （尤指体育比赛的）观众

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: spectacle
trans: n.  Epl.］眼镜；景象；场面；出人意外的情况

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: spectrum
trans: n. 范围；光谱；声谱

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: retrospect
trans: n. 回顾vi. 追溯

sentences.english: In retrospect, I wonder if we should have done more.
sentences.chinese: 回过头看，我在想我们是否应该做得更多些。

detailed_translations.english: thinking back to a time in the past, especially with the advantage of knowing more now than you did then

name: participate
trans: vi. 参加，参与

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: captive
trans: a. 被监禁的；受控制的n. 俘虏

sentences.english: captive soldiers
sentences.chinese: 被俘的士兵

sentences.english: captive animals
sentences.chinese: 被关住的动物

sentences.english: His son had been taken captive (= became a prisoner ) during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子在这次突袭中被劫持了。

sentences.english: a pilot who was held captive (= kept as a prisoner ) for six years
sentences.chinese: 一名被囚六年的飞行员

detailed_translations.chinese: 被俘虏的， 被监禁的
detailed_translations.english: kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave
someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war

name: exceptional
trans: a. 优秀的；异常的；特殊的

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: admit
trans: v. 承认vt. 准许......进入；接收（入院）

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: transmit
trans: v. 传送vt. 传播

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: messenger
trans: n. 信使；通信员；邮递员

sentences.english: There will be a messenger at the airport to collect the photographs from our courier.
sentences.chinese: 机场会有一名信使从我们的快递员那儿取走照片。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金vt. 委托

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: speciality
trans: n. 专长；专业；特产

sentences.english: the region’s speciality cheese
sentences.chinese: 该地区的特色干酪

sentences.english: His speciality is international law.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是国际法。

detailed_translations.chinese: (specialty) 特色食品; 特产；专业；专门研究；专长
detailed_translations.english: Someone's speciality is a particular type of work that they do most or do best, or a subject that they know a lot about

name: charity
trans: n. 慈善机构；慈善；施舍；仁慈

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

name: harness
trans: vt. 控制；利用；给（马等）上挽具n. 保护带

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: sophisticated
trans: a. 老练的；久经世故的；精密的；复杂巧妙的

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

name: sacred
trans: a. 神圣的；宗教的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: preceding
trans: a. 前面的

sentences.english: As we saw in the preceding chapter, groups can be powerful agents of socialization.
sentences.chinese: 如我们在前一章所见，团组可以是社会化的有力动因。

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming before the time, place, or part mentioned

name: precedent
trans: n. 先例，前例

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

name: exceed
trans: vt. 超过;超越

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: proceeding
trans: n.  ［C-常用pl.］诉讼；［pl.］过程

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

name: necessitate
trans: vt. 迫使；使成为必要；需要

sentences.english: Lack of money necessitated a change of plan.

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

trans: n. 让步，妥协；承认；特许权

sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

detailed_translations.english: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

name: parliament
trans: n.  EP-］英国议会；议会；国会

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

trans: n. 装饰品；首饰；装饰vt. 装饰

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 照亮；阐明，解释

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

trans: n. 侵犯；涌入

sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

trans: vt. 包含；使并入

sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: intensive
trans: a. 密集的；集约的；彻底的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: incline
trans: v. （使）倾向于vt. 点头n. 斜坡

sentences.english: a steep incline
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

name: intact
trans: a. 完整无缺的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

trans: v. 继承vt. 经遗传获得

sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: instruct
trans: vt. 指ZK;指导；教授；通知

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: classification
trans: n. 分类；类别

sentences.english: the classification of wines according to quality
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒按品质的分类

sentences.english: There are five job classifications.
sentences.chinese: 有五种工作类别。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

name: navigation
trans: n. 导航；航行

sentences.english: compasses and other instruments of navigation
sentences.chinese: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

detailed_translations.chinese: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
detailed_translations.english: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

name: aviation
trans: n. 航空

sentences.english: ...the aviation industry.
sentences.chinese: …航空工业。

detailed_translations.english: the science or practice of flying in aircraft

name: temptation
trans: n. 诱惑，引诱；诱惑人的东西

sentences.english: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you’re certain you need it.
sentences.chinese: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑，除非你确有需要。

sentences.chinese: 我最终还是屈从诱惑，抽了一支烟。

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

trans: n. 联盟；联邦；同盟

sentences.english: the National Federation of Women’s Institutes
sentences.chinese: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府
detailed_translations.english: a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group

name: variation
trans: n. 变化

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: painter
trans: n. 画家；油漆匠

sentences.english: Gerry’s ambition was to become a portrait painter.
sentences.chinese: 格里的志向是成为一名肖像画家。

sentences.english: painter and decorator
sentences.chinese: 油漆装修工

detailed_translations.english: someone who paints pictures

name: premier
trans: n. （加拿大、澳洲的）省长；总理，首相a. 首要的

sentences.english: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
sentences.chinese: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

detailed_translations.english: best or most important
a  prime minister  – used in news reports

name: outer
trans: a. 外面的；外部的；外表的；远离中心的

sentences.english: His inner conflict is related to struggles in the outer world.
sentences.chinese: 他内心的矛盾和外部世界的争斗有关。

detailed_translations.english: relating to objects, activities etc that are part of the world, as opposed to your own thoughts and feelings

name: wedding
trans: n. 婚礼

sentences.english: She’s busy planning her daughter’s wedding.
sentences.chinese: 她正忙着筹备女儿的婚礼。

sentences.english: When is the wedding?
sentences.chinese: 婚礼是什么时候？

detailed_translations.english: a marriage ceremony, especially one with a religious service

trans: n. ［常用pl.］缺点

sentences.english: Peter was painfully aware of his own shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 彼得痛苦地认识到了自己的短处。

detailed_translations.english: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be

name: striking
trans: a. 显著的；引人注目的；惊人的

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: following
trans: a. 下列的；接着的prep. 在（某事）以后

sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他生病了，但第二天就好一些了。

sentences.chinese: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。

detailed_translations.english: the next afternoon, month etc

trans: a. 简明的，简洁的

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

trans: a. 精确的，准确的；一丝不苟的；确切的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: decisive
trans: a. 决定性的；果断的

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

name: resume
trans: n. 简历；概述v. 重新开始

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: preach
trans: v. 布道；宣扬

sentences.english: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输
detailed_translations.english: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

name: premium
trans: n. 保险费；附加费a. 高昂的；优质的

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: prevail
trans: vi. 流行；战胜

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

trans: vt. 设计，想出；发明

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

sentences.chinese: 尽量吃富含维生素和矿物质的食物。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

trans: vt. 想象；设想

sentences.chinese: 该计划的花费大大超出了我们最初所预想的数额。

sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.

sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: erroneous
trans: a. 错误的

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

trans: n. 奇迹

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: operate
trans: vt. 操作v. （使）运转vt. 动手术

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: operator
trans: n. 操作员；经营者；电话员；专业公司

sentences.english: Hello, operator? Could you put me through to Room 31?
sentences.chinese: 喂，接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

sentences.english: computers which can be used by untrained operators
sentences.chinese: 未经训练的操作者也可使用的电脑

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a telephone switchboard, who you can call for help

name: accommodate
trans: vt. 容纳；为......提供住处v. 适应

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: accommodation
trans: n. 住处；［pl.］住宿；和解

sentences.english: The price for the holiday includes flights and accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 度假的价格包括机票和住宿。

sentences.english: living accommodations for the crews
sentences.chinese: 船员的起居舱

sentences.english: travel and hotel accommodations
sentences.chinese: 旅行及酒店住宿

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["rented accommodation"]}
sentences.chinese: 租用的住处

sentences.english: secure accommodation for young offenders
sentences.chinese: 严密看管的少年犯囚室

sentences.english: Universities have to provide student accommodation for first-year students.
sentences.chinese: 大学必须为一年级生提供学生宿舍。

detailed_translations.english: a place for someone to stay, live, or work

name: tremble
trans: vi. 发抖；焦虑n. 颤抖

sentences.english: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.english: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远不会忘记那病人脸上的表情和他颤抖的手。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

name: crude
trans: a. 天然的；粗糙的；简略的；粗俗的

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

name: fiscal
trans: a. 财政的

sentences.english: a fiscal crisis
sentences.chinese: 财政危机

sentences.english: a fiscal matter
sentences.chinese: 财政事务

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, taxes, debts etc that are owned and managed by the government

name: intrinsic
trans: a. 内在的；固有的

sentences.english: the intrinsic interest of the subject
sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

detailed_translations.english: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

name: memorial
trans: a. 纪念的；悼念的n. 纪念碑；纪念

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: commemorate
trans: vt. 纪念；庆祝

sentences.english: a parade to commemorate the town’s bicentenary
sentences.chinese: 庆祝该镇建立200周年的游行

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

name: massacre
trans: n.  /vt. 屠杀

sentences.english: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.chinese: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.english: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

name: intimate
trans: a. 亲密的；个人的

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: casualty
trans: n. 伤亡人员；受害者；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: occasion
trans: n. 场合；时机【僻】n. 理由，原因

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: conquer
trans: vt. 征服；战胜；攻占；克服

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: questionnaire
trans: n. 调查表，问卷

sentences.english: Teachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

name: plead
trans: v. 恳求；认罪

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: pleasant
trans: a. 令人愉快的；宜人的；友好的

sentences.english: It had been a pleasant evening.
sentences.chinese: 那是个愉快的夜晚。

sentences.english: the pleasant climate of Southern California
sentences.chinese: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候

sentences.english: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。

sentences.english: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
sentences.chinese: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

detailed_translations.english: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy

name: regulate
trans: vt. 管理；调整

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: sovereign
trans: a. 有主权的；拥有最高统治权的n. 君主

sentences.english: In March 1889, she became the first British sovereign to set foot on Spanish soil.
sentences.chinese: 1889年3月，她成为首位踏上西班牙国土的英国君主。

sentences.english: a sovereign ruler
sentences.chinese: 最高统治者

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen
having the highest power in a country

name: startle
trans: vt. 使惊吓；使大吃一惊

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: personnel
trans: n.  ［pl.］全体人员；职员；人事部门

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: scarcely
trans: ad,几乎不

sentences.english: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。

sentences.english: The country had scarcely any industry.
sentences.chinese: 该国几乎没有工业。

sentences.english: He scarcely ever left the region.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

sentences.english: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他刚坐下就有人敲门。

detailed_translations.english: almost not or almost none at all

name: seemingly
trans: ad. 看似；似乎

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: undoubtedly
trans: ad. 无疑地

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: literally
trans: ad. 按字面；逐字地；简直

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: transistor
trans: n. 晶体管

sentences.english: Every transistor has at least three electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.english: The transistor became the basis of a new invention called the "computer" which I suspect those of you reading this may be familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

name: translation
trans: n. 翻译；译文

sentences.english: She read the letter and gave us a rough translation (= she did not translate everything exactly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她看了信，给我们大概翻译了一下。

sentences.english: I’ve only read ‘Madame Bovary’ in translation (= not in its original language ) .
sentences.chinese: 我只读过《包法利夫人》的翻译本。

sentences.english: Much of the book’s humour has been lost in translation (= is no longer effective when translated ) .
sentences.chinese: 本书的许多幽默元素已在翻译过程中丢失。

detailed_translations.english: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

name: transparent
trans: a. 透明的；显而易见的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: intervene
trans: vi. 干预；介入；出面

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: convenient
trans: a. 方便的；便利的

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

name: convenience
trans: n. 方便；便利；便利设施

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

name: advent
trans: n. 到来；出现

sentences.english: the advent of the computer
sentences.chinese: 计算机的问世

detailed_translations.chinese: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
detailed_translations.english: the time when something first begins to be widely used

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；编造

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: inventory
trans: n. 清单；库存

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

name: venture
trans: n. 冒险事业；企业vi. 冒险去（某处）

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: probe
trans: v. 探究；调查

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: approve
trans: vt. 批准，通过vi. 赞成

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: passion
trans: n. 激情；盛怒；酷爱

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

name: sympathetic
trans: a. 同情的；赞同的；招人喜爱的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: patience
trans: n. 耐心；忍耐力

sentences.english: He doesn't have the patience to wait.
sentences.chinese: 他没有耐心等。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or sth annoying without complaining

name: mystery
trans: n. 神秘；神秘的事物a. 神秘的

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: scenery
trans: n. 风景，景色；舞台，布景

sentences.english: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
sentences.chinese: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

sentences.english: Instead of stagehands, the actors will move the scenery right in front of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 演员们将替代舞台工作人员，当着观众的面置换布景。

detailed_translations.english: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

name: substitute
trans: n. 代替品v. 代替

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: subjective
trans: a. 主观的

sentences.english: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.chinese: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.english: a highly subjective point of view
sentences.chinese: 相当主观的看法

detailed_translations.english: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair

name: surname
trans: n. 姓

sentences.english: What is your surname?
sentences.chinese: 你姓什么?

sentences.english: Your surname may be derived from a place, such as Lancaster, for example, or an occupation, such as Weaver, but this is not necessarily of relevance to your family history.
sentences.chinese: 或许，你的姓氏来源于一个地方名，例如兰开斯特，或者来源于职业，例如编织工。 但是，这并不能中肯地说出你家族的历史。

detailed_translations.english: the name that you share with your parents, or often with your husband if you are a married woman, and which in English comes at the end of your full name

name: suspicion
trans: n. 怀疑

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: suburb
trans: n. 郊区；［pl.］城郊住宅区

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

name: amiable
trans: a. 友善的，亲切的

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: She was in an amiable mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情很好。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to like

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

name: agreeable
trans: a. 欣然同意的；愉悦的；讨人喜欢的；适合的

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

name: formidable
trans: a. 可怕的；难对付的；艰巨的；令人惊叹的

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: miserable
trans: a. 使难受的；痛苦的；太少的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: sociable
trans: a. 好交际的；合群的；友好的

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: sanction
trans: n.  ［C-常用pl.］制裁;许可vt. 批准

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: obsession
trans: n. 痴迷；使人痴迷的人（或物）

sentences.english: Gambling became an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
sentences.chinese: 他迷上赌博，最后失去了一切。

sentences.english: The game pachinko became a national obsession.
sentences.chinese: 弹珠机游戏已经风靡全国。

sentences.english: He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 他对艺术很热衷，在我看来已经到了痴迷的程度。

sentences.english: She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession.
sentences.chinese: 她尽心尽力地照顾他，简直到了沉迷的地步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痴迷；困扰；[内科][心理] 强迫观念
detailed_translations.english: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else

name: conjunction
trans: n. 结合；连词；与……起

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result

name: illiterate
trans: a. 不识字的；不通顺的；了解不多的n. 文盲

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: deteriorate
trans: vi. 恶化，变坏

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: permeate
trans: v. 弥漫，渗透

sentences.english: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气里充斥着柴油的气味。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it

name: donate
trans: v. 捐赠vt. 献（血）；捐献（器官）

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: tolerate
trans: vt. 忍受；容许

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: allocate
trans: vt. 分配

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: initiate
trans: vt. 发起；开始；使加入

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: fabricate
trans: vt. 编造；伪造；制造；装配

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: calculate
trans: vt. 计算；估计；预测

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: fascinate
trans: v. 深深吸引，迷住

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: frustrate
trans: vt. 挫败，阻止；使懊恼

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: articulate
trans: vt. 明确表达a. 善于表达的；发音清晰的

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: agitate
trans: vi. 鼓动vt. 使激动；搅动

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

name: alleviate
trans: vt. 减轻；缓和；缓解

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: consolidate
trans: v. 使巩固；合并

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
