sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

name: activate
trans: vt. 激活；使运作

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: saturate
trans: vt. 使充满，使饱和；使湿透

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: liberate
trans: vt. 解放；使解脱；释放（囚犯）

sentences.english: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，我军解放了这座城市。

detailed_translations.english: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control

name: distort
trans: vt. 扭曲；曲解；使变形

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: soar
trans: vi. 翱翔；急升，猛增

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: orient
trans: vt. 确定方向；朝向；使适应

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: endurance
trans: n. 忍耐力

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: durable
trans: a. 耐用的；持久的

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: duration
trans: n. 持续时间；期间

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: magnificent
trans: a. 宏伟的；壮丽的；华丽的；值得赞扬的

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: magnify
trans: vt. 放大；扩大；增强；夸大

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: magnitude
trans: n. 重大，重要性；震级

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

detailed_translations.english: the great size or importance of something

name: summary
trans: n. 总结，概括a. 草草的

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

name: summarize
trans: v. 概括；概述；总结

sentences.english: The authors summarize their views in the introduction.
sentences.chinese: 作者在序言里概述了他们的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc

name: reckless
trans: a. 鲁莽的；不计后果的；无所顾忌的

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

name: humble
trans: a. 谦逊的；普通的；卑微的；简陋的【僻】a. 简单但实用的

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: humiliate
trans: vt. 羞辱；使蒙羞

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: withhold
trans: vt. 拒绝给；扣留；隐瞒

sentences.english: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to give someone something

name: hypocrisy
trans: n. 虚伪，伪善

sentences.english: It would be sheer hypocrisy to pray for success, since I’ve never believed in God.
sentences.chinese: 我从不相信上帝，因此为获成功而祈祷是纯粹的虚伪之举。

detailed_translations.english: when someone pretends to have certain beliefs or opinions that they do not really have – used to show disapproval

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；聚居人群；群，群体

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: quantitative
trans: a. 定量的；数量的

sentences.english: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

detailed_translations.english: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something

name: tribute
trans: n. 致敬；贡品；体现

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: sincere
trans: a. 真诚的；诚挚的；诚恳的

sentences.english: Please accept my sincere apologies .
sentences.chinese: 请接受我真诚的道歉。

sentences.english: his sincere desire to find out the truth
sentences.chinese: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

detailed_translations.english: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

name: fortunate
trans: a. 幸运的；侥幸的

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: unfortunately
trans: ad. 不幸地；可惜地

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

name: hemisphere
trans: n. （地球的）半球；（大脑的）半球

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: paralyse
trans: vt. 使瘫痪；使麻痹；使陷入瘫痪

sentences.english: Her legs were partly paralysed in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 在撞车事故中她的双腿部分瘫痪。

detailed_translations.english: if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it

name: console
trans: vt. 安慰，慰藉

sentences.english: No one could console her when Peter died.
sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed
a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

name: soldier
trans: n.  士兵；军人

sentences.english: A British soldier was wounded in the fighting.
sentences.chinese: 战斗中，有一名英国士兵受了伤。

sentences.english: an enemy soldier
sentences.chinese: 敌兵

detailed_translations.chinese: 军人；[昆] 兵蚁；懒汉；一片烤面包
detailed_translations.english: a member of the army of a country, especially someone who is not an officer

detailed_translations.chinese: 当兵；磨洋工；坚持干；假称害病

name: territory
trans: n. 领土；领域

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: terrible
trans: a. 可怕的；糟糕的；令人极不快的；劣质的

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: terrific
trans: a. 极好的；巨大的

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

name: confirm
trans: vt. 证实；批准；确认；使确信

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: affirm
trans: vt. 公开肯定；申明；断言；证实

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: constrain
trans: t.限制；约束；强迫

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: restrain
trans: vt. 抑制；控制；阻止；制止

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: restraint
trans: n. 克制；抑制；约束；［常用pl.］限制

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

name: testify
trans: v. 作证；证明

sentences.english: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

sentences.english: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
sentences.chinese: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

detailed_translations.english: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

name: bewilder
trans: vt. 使迷惑；使糊涂

sentences.english: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
sentences.chinese: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone

name: behave
trans: vi. 表现；行为；（科学领域）运动表现

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: fearful
trans: a. 担心的；可怕的；严重的

sentences.english: a shy and fearful child
sentences.chinese: 一个羞涩、胆怯的小孩

detailed_translations.english: frightened that something bad might happen

name: superb
trans: a. 极好的；卓越的；超凡的

sentences.english: The food was superb.
sentences.chinese: 食物好吃极了。

sentences.english: superb weather
sentences.chinese: 极好的天气

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: superficial
trans: 肤浅的；表面的；表皮的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: superstition
trans: n. 迷信

sentences.english: the old superstition that walking under a ladder is unlucky
sentences.chinese: 认为从梯子下面穿过不吉利的古老迷信

detailed_translations.english: a belief that some objects or actions are lucky or unlucky, or that they cause events to happen, based on old ideas of magic

name: supreme
trans: a. 最高的；最大的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

name: auxiliary
trans: a. 辅助的；备用的n. 辅助人员

sentences.english: a nursing auxiliary
sentences.chinese: 护理辅助人员

detailed_translations.chinese: 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构
detailed_translations.english: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

name: elementary
trans: n. 初级的；基础的；基本的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: secondary
trans: a. 次要的；中学的；继发性的；间接引发的

sentences.english: the novel’s secondary characters
sentences.chinese: 这本小说中的次要人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as something else

name: extraordinary
trans: a. 非凡的；异乎寻常的；特别的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: nuisance
trans: n. 麻烦事；讨厌的人；妨害行为【僻】n. 妨害罪

sentences.english: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

name: allegiance
trans: n. 忠诚，效忠

sentences.english: an oath of allegiance
sentences.chinese: 效忠宣誓

sentences.english: The people here have strong political allegiances .
sentences.chinese: 这里的民众政治忠诚度很高。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a leader, country, belief etc

name: detach
trans: v. （使）分离vt. 摆脱；派遣

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: derive
trans: v. 源于vt. 得到

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: descend
trans: v. 下来，下降vi. 降临

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: defy
trans: vt. 反抗；藐视

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: deduce
trans: vt. 推断；演绎出（事实，结论）

sentences.english: Alison cleverly deduced that I was the author of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森聪明地推断出我是这封信的作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推论， 推断， 演绎
detailed_translations.english: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

name: cooperative
trans: a. 合作的；配合的n. 合作社组织

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: coordinate
trans: vt. 使协调v. 搭配n. 坐标

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

name: coalition
trans: n. 联合政府；（尤指多个政治团体的）联盟；联盟

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

name: complain
trans: v. 抱怨，埋怨；诉说

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: compile
trans: vt编写（书、列表、报告等）；编纂

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件是由卫生部汇编的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: comprehend
trans: v. 理解，领悟

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehension
trans: n. 理解（力）；（语言学习中的）理解练习

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: converge
trans: vi. 聚集；集中；会合【僻】v. 趋于相同

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会合， 互相靠拢； 聚集， 集中； 趋近
detailed_translations.english: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing

name: contest
trans: n. 比赛；竞争vt. 争取赢得；争夺

sentences.english: Stone decided to hold a contest to see who could write the best song.
sentences.chinese: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.english: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.english: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.chinese: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.english: the 1975 Liberal leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 1975年自由党的领导权之争

detailed_translations.english: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 争夺， 与…竞争； 对…提出质疑， 辩驳
detailed_translations.english: to say formally that you do not accept something or do not agree with it

name: contemplate
trans: vt. 考虑；凝视v. 沉思

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: condemn
trans: vt. 谴责；宣判；迫使……接受困境

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: conceal
trans: vt. 隐藏；隐瞒

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: condense
trans: v. （使）浓缩；（使）凝结

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: confess
trans: v. 供认，承认，坦白（错误或罪行）

sentences.english: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.english: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

detailed_translations.english: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

name: regardless
trans: ad. 不顾；无论；不管怎样

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: awkward
trans: a. 令人尴尬的；（使用）不便的；笨拙的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: upward
trans: a. 向上的；上升的

sentences.english: upward pressure on bank interest rates
sentences.chinese: 针对银行利率的越来越大的压力

sentences.english: They climbed upward along the steep cliffs surrounding the village.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着环绕村庄的陡峭悬崖向上爬。

sentences.english: 'There,' said Jack, pointing upwards.
sentences.chinese: “那儿，”杰克往上指着说。

detailed_translations.english: increasing to a higher level
If someone moves or looks upward, they move or look up towards a higher place

name: outward
trans: a. 向外的；外表的ad. 向外地

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

name: dilute
trans: vt. 稀释；削弱；降低a. 稀释了的

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: disgrace
trans: n. 耻辱；不光彩；令人感到羞耻的事vt. 使丢脸

sentences.english: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
sentences.chinese: 事情发生之后，史密斯声名狼藉。

sentences.english: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为让家人蒙羞。

sentences.english: How could you disgrace us all like that?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能这样丢我们大家的脸呢？

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed

name: disable
trans: vt. 使伤残；使丧失能力；使无效，使不能运转

sentences.english: She did all this tendon damage and it really disabled her.
sentences.chinese: 她肌腱受了这么多损伤，这真地使她致残了。

detailed_translations.english: If an injury or illness disables someone, it affects them so badly that it restricts the way that they can live their life

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: diploma
trans: n. 文凭；文凭课程；学位证书

sentences.english: a High School diploma
sentences.chinese: 高中毕业文凭

detailed_translations.english: a document showing that a student has successfully completed their high school or university education

name: disappoint
trans: v. 使失望vt. 使破灭

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: disguise
trans: vt. 伪装；掩饰n. 伪装物

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: discourse
trans: n. 演讲；正式讨论

sentences.english: "I do not know. " And thus ended their discourse.
sentences.chinese: “我也不晓得。”就这样，他们的谈话结束了。 。

sentences.english: They listened to his discourse on human relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。

sentences.english: In discourse thou must attend to what is said, and in every movement thou must observe what is doing.
sentences.chinese: 在谈话中你必须注意所说的话，在任何活动中你都必须观察在做什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲， 谈话， 论文
detailed_translations.english: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；转移

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: adolescent
trans: n. 青少年a. 青少年的；青春期的

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: ingredient
trans: n. 成分；因素；要素

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: violent
trans: a. 暴力的；剧烈的；强烈的

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: diligent
trans: a. 勤奋的

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

name: eminent
trans: a. 著名的；杰出的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: indifferent
trans: a. 漠不关心的；冷淡的；平庸的；一般的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: senator
trans: n. 参议员

sentences.english: Senator Kennedy
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪参议员

detailed_translations.english: a member of the Senate or a senate

name: addition
trans: n. 加法；添加；添加物

sentences.english: This is a fine book; a worthy addition to the series.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本好书——是对这套丛书有价值的增补。

detailed_translations.chinese: 加， 加法； 附加物
detailed_translations.english: something that is added to something else, often in order to improve it

name: misfortune
trans: n. 不幸；不幸的事故

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

name: maintenance
trans: n. 保持；维护；保养；抚养费

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

name: divine
trans: a. 神的，上帝的；绝妙的vt. 猜到

sentences.english: divine power
sentences.chinese: 神的力量

sentences.english: divine love
sentences.chinese: 上帝的慈爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 神圣的；非凡的；天赐的；极好的
detailed_translations.english: coming from or relating to God or a god

name: perpetual
trans: a. 持续的；没完没了的；一再反复的；永久的

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

name: offset
trans: vt. 抵消;补偿；弥补

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: abound
trans: vi. 大量存在；盛产，富于

sentences.english: Rumors of such coordination abound, but as with many rumors, they have no basis in fact.
sentences.chinese: 关于这类协调的谣传很多；但如同许多其他谣传一样，它们没有事实根据。

sentences.english: Finally, offer this closing prayer to the Lord: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 最后，将结束的祷告告诉主：愿在你拥有信仰的时候希望的上帝用快乐与和平充满你的人生，让你在圣灵的力量下富于希望。

name: surroundings
trans: n. 环境

sentences.english: I need to work in pleasant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 我需要在舒适的环境下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the objects, buildings, natural things etc that are around a person or thing at a particular time

name: hypothesis
trans: n.  （pl.）假说，假设n. 猜测

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: oblige
trans: vt. 迫使v. 施恩惠于，帮忙【僻】v. 感邀/

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: league
trans: n. 联盟；联赛；级别【僻】里格（长度单位，约3英里）

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

name: interfere
trans: vi. 干涉，干预；妨碍

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；创业者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: cherish
trans: vt. 珍爱；珍惜；抱有（希望）；怀念

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

name: temper
trans: n. 脾气；怒气vt. 使缓和

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

name: temperament
trans: n. 气质；性情

sentences.english: His impulsive temperament regularly got him into difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他容易冲动的性格经常使他陷入困境。

detailed_translations.english: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

name: vanity
trans: n. 虚荣（心）；（尤指与其他重大事物相比）渺小

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

name: vanish
trans: vi. 消失；突然不见；绝迹

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: vacuum
trans: n. 真空；真空状态v. 用真空吸尘器清扫

sentences.english: I vacuumed the carpets today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集； 用真空吸尘器打扫
detailed_translations.english: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

name: scholarship
trans: n. 奖学金学问，学术

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动，上下浮动

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: adhere
trans: vi. 遵守；坚持；黏附，附着

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: coherent
trans: a. 连贯的；一致的；有条理的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: hesitate
trans: v. 犹豫vt. （因有顾虑而）不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: genre
trans: n. 体裁；类型

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

name: genius
trans: n. 天才；天赋；天才人物

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius
sentences.chinese: 天才之作

detailed_translations.english: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

name: overhead
trans: ad. 在头顶上方a. 头顶上的；高架的

sentences.english: Bullets whizzed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 子弹嗖嗖地掠过头顶。

sentences.english: A plane flew overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机从头顶飞过。

sentences.english: She turned on the overhead light and looked around the little room.
sentences.chinese: 她打开顶灯，环视这间小屋。

detailed_translations.english: above your head or in the sky
You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about

detailed_translations.chinese: 经常费用， 管理费用
detailed_translations.english: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating

name: overlap
trans: v. 部分重叠，交叠n. 重叠部分

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: overcome
trans: vt. 克服；战胜；熏倒

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: compel
trans: vt. 强迫，迫使；引起

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: compulsory
trans: a. 强制的；必须做的；义务的

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识；专门技能

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: perish
trans: vi. 死亡；湮灭；腐烂；老化

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

name: obstacle
trans: n. 阻碍，障碍；障碍物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: stalk
trans: n. 茎，秆；柄vt. 跟踪vi. 高视阔步【僻】v. 潜近（猎物或人）

sentences.english: celery stalks
sentences.chinese: 芹菜茎

detailed_translations.english: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them

name: consist
trans: vi. 由......组成，由......构成；在于

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: consistent
trans: a.  一致的；一贯的；持续的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: resist
trans: v. 抵制；反抗，抵抗

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: resistant
trans: a. 抵制的；抵抗的；有抵抗力的

sentences.english: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.
sentences.chinese: 一些人对锻炼的主意非常抵制。

detailed_translations.english: not damaged or affected by something

name: assist
trans: v. 帮助vt. 促进

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: persist
trans: v. 坚持vi. 持续存在

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: estate
trans: n. 地产；庄园；遗产

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: pamphlet
trans: n. 小册子

sentences.english: a political pamphlet
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传册

detailed_translations.english: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

name: trumpet
trans: n. 喇叭；小号vt. 吹嘘；宣扬

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way

name: tablet
trans: n. 药片；匾，碑；平板电脑

sentences.english: She took a couple of headache tablets .
sentences.chinese: 她吃了几片头痛药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 碑；药片；写字板；小块；平板电脑
detailed_translations.english: a small round hard piece of medicine which you swallow

detailed_translations.chinese: 用碑牌纪念；将(备忘录等)写在板上；将…制成小片或小块

name: packet
trans: n. 包装袋；小包裹；数据包；一笔巨款

sentences.english: Paul tore open the packet as soon as it arrived.
sentences.chinese: 保罗一收到包裹就拆开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数据包，信息包；小包，小捆
detailed_translations.english: a small flat package that is sent by post or delivered to someone

name: suspend
trans: vt. 悬挂；暂停，中止；延缓；使暂时停职

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

name: indispensable
trans: a. 必需的，必不可少的，不可或缺的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: evaporate
trans: v. 蒸发vi. 消失

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: educate
trans: vt. 教育；教导；培养；训练

sentences.english: The Ormerod School educates handicapped children.
sentences.chinese: 奥默罗德学校的教育对象为残疾儿童。

sentences.english: a campaign to educate teenagers about HIV
sentences.chinese: 教育青少年了解艾滋病病毒的运动

detailed_translations.english: to teach a child at a school, college, or university

name: expire
trans: vi. 到期;届满；逝世

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

name: extract
trans: vt. 摘录；提取；取出n. 摘录【僻】v. 获得（某种感觉或品质）

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: exotic
trans: a. 来自异国的；奇异的；外来的

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: extinct
trans: a. 绝种的；绝迹的；（火山）死的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: excel
trans: vi. 擅长，善于；胜过他人vt. 胜过平时

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: hostile
trans: a. 敌对的，怀有敌意的；敌人的；不利的

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: hospitality
trans: n. 好客；款待

sentences.english: Thanks for your hospitality over the past few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你几周来的热情款待。

detailed_translations.english: friendly behaviour towards visitors

name: complement
trans: vt. 补充n. 补足物；足额；补足语

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

name: appliance
trans: n. 电器，器具；应用

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: multiply
trans: v. 乘；成倍增加

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: imply
trans: vt. 暗示；意味着

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: applicable
trans: a. 适用的，合适的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: corridor
trans: n. 走廊

sentences.english: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这儿走，浴室就在走廊的尽头。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it

name: recur
trans: vi. 重现；反复出现；再次发生，复发

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: occurrence
trans: n. 发生；出现；发生的事情，事件

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

name: accurate
trans: a. 准确的；精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: recover
trans: v. 恢复vi. 复原vt. 重新获得

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: refresh
trans: vt. 使提神；提醒v. 更新，刷新

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: revolve
trans: v. （使）旋转vi. 环绕；围绕......转

sentences.english: The wheel began to revolve.
sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.english: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.english: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑
detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

name: relate
trans: vt. 联系；叙述；讲述vi. 有关联，涉及

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: revise
trans: vt. 改变；修订v. 复习

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: recite
trans: v. 吟诵，背诵vt. 详述；列举

sentences.english: She recited a poem that she had learnt at school.
sentences.chinese: 她背诵了一首学校里学的诗。

detailed_translations.english: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to

name: revelation
trans: n. 被暴露的真相；揭露；启示

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: recreation
trans: n. 消遣，娱乐；娱乐活动

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: reservoir
trans: n. 水库；储备

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

name: remedy
trans: n. 解决方法；疗法；药品vt. 纠正

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: embarrass
trans: vt. 使尴尬；使为难；使陷入困境

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: embed
trans: vt. 使嵌入，使插入；使（态度、感情等）根植于

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: endorse
trans: vt. 赞同，支持；（在支票背面）签名，背书

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: enforce
trans: vt. 强制执行，强行实施；强迫

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

name: entail
trans: vt. 需要；导致

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: enlighten
trans: vt. 启发；开导；教导；阐明

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: latitude
trans: n. 纬度；自由度；［pl.］纬度地区【僻】n. 选择（做什么事或做事方式的）自由

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: gratitude
trans: n. 感激之情，感谢

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: seminar
trans: n. 研讨会；研讨课

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

name: vulgar
trans: a. 庸俗的；粗俗的；下流的

sentences.english: vulgar behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗俗的行为

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

name: wherever
trans: conj,在任何地方ad. 究竟在哪里

sentences.english: Children will play wherever they happen to be.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子走到哪里玩到哪里。

sentences.english: Sit wherever you like.
sentences.chinese: 随便坐吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论什么地方；究竟在哪里
detailed_translations.english: to or at any place, position, or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论在哪里；无论什么情况下

name: air-conditioning
trans: n. 空调设备；空调系统

sentences.english: The two chief function of any air-conditioning system are the regulation of air temperature and humidity.
sentences.chinese: 任何空气调节系统的两大主要功能，就是调节空气的温度和湿度。

sentences.english: The intention and Standard of the cleanout and disinfection operation of central air-conditioning system isdescribed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要介绍了中央空调系统中清洗、消毒工程的目的、要求、标准、规程、步骤、方法等。

sentences.english: In underground water source heating pump air-conditioning system of one guesthouse project, the heating pump unit does not always run at full load status.
sentences.chinese: 某宾馆工程地下水源热泵空调系统中，热泵机组在实际运行中不总处于满负荷运行状态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空调设备， 空调系统
detailed_translations.english: Air-conditioning is a method of providing buildings and vehicles with cool dry air

name: grown-up
trans: a. 成年的；适于成人的n. 大人

sentences.english: Before you know it, the children will be grown-up and leaving home.
sentences.chinese: 转眼之间，孩子们就会长大成人离家而去。

sentences.english: I’ve got two grown-up sons.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个已经成年的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成长的； 成熟的； 成人的
detailed_translations.english: fully developed as an adult
an adult – used by or to children

name: handbook
trans: n. 手册；指南

sentences.english: the Fiction Writer’s Handbook
sentences.chinese: 《小说写作手册》

detailed_translations.english: a short book that gives information or instructions about something

name: highway
trans: n. 公路；交通要道；公用通道

sentences.english: Interstate Highway 75
sentences.chinese: 75号州际公路

detailed_translations.english: a wide main road that joins one town to another

name: spokesman
trans: n. 发言人

sentences.english: a White House spokesman
sentences.chinese: 白宫发言人

detailed_translations.english: a man who has been chosen to speak officially for a group, organization, or government

name: Thanksgiving
trans: n. 感恩节

sentences.english: He said sometimes they would invite some friends to share the happiness of Thanksgiving Day.
sentences.chinese: 他说有时候他们也会邀请一些朋友来一起分享感恩节快乐。

sentences.english: I hear about these people every Thanksgiving, then never think about them again for the next 364 days.
sentences.chinese: 我在每个感恩节都听说过这群人，而后在接下来的364天，就再也没有想起过他们。

sentences.english: It compares with "Cyber Monday" in the US - the day after Thanksgiving marketed as a big online shopping day.
sentences.chinese: 它与“网络星期一”在美国，感恩节后的第一天销售作为一个大型网上购物一天。

detailed_translations.english: a public holiday in the US and in Canada when families have a large meal together to celebrate and be thankful for food, health, families etc

name: up-to-date
trans: a. 最新的

sentences.english: ...the most up-to-date information available on foods today.
sentences.chinese: …今日有关食品的最新消息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直到最近的， 现代的； 跟上时代的
detailed_translations.english: modern or fashionable

name: platform
trans: n. 平台；月台；讲台；纲领

sentences.english: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: aeroplane
trans: n. 飞机

sentences.english: The noise of the aeroplane deafened us.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的噪声使我们耳朵听不见了。

sentences.english: An aeroplane offers you an unusual and breathtaking view of the world.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机提供了你一个不寻常的和惊人的世界观。

sentences.english: With your own aeroplane you fly where and when you want to , often to and from airfields that are not served by airlines .
sentences.chinese: 用自己的飞机，你可以随时去你想去的地方，起降的机场通常也不对航空公司开放。

detailed_translations.english: a flying vehicle with wings and at least one engine

name: birthday
trans: n. 生日

sentences.english: It’s my birthday on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一是我的生日。

sentences.english: My aunt called to wish me a happy birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈打电话来祝我生日快乐。

sentences.english: The City of Cleveland Orchestra is celebrating its 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 克利夫兰市管弦乐队正在庆祝乐队成立200周年。

detailed_translations.english: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

name: blueprint
trans: n. 蓝图

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: forthcoming
trans: a. 即将到来的；即将发生（或出版等）的

sentences.english: the forthcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将到来的选举

sentences.english: Keep an eye on the noticeboards for forthcoming events .
sentences.chinese: 请注意布告牌上的活动预告。

detailed_translations.english: a forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon

name: housewife
trans: n. 家庭主妇，主妇

sentences.english: Married at nineteen, she was a traditional housewife and mother of four children.
sentences.chinese: 她19岁就结婚了，是个传统的家庭主妇和4个孩子的母亲。

detailed_translations.english: a married woman who works at home doing the cooking, cleaning etc, but does not have a job outside the house

name: landlord
trans: n. 房东；地主；老板

sentences.english: His landlord doubled the rent.
sentences.chinese: 他的房东把房租提高了一倍。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone

name: overwhelm
trans: vt. 击败；淹没

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: hamburger
trans: n. 汉堡包

sentences.english: A hamburger and a coke.
sentences.chinese: 一个汉堡和一杯可乐。

sentences.english: Then have a hamburger.
sentences.chinese: 那么吃一个汉堡吧。

sentences.english: I order a soda and a hamburger for myself. Then another person gets coffee for me.
sentences.chinese: 嗯， 我为自己点了一杯苏打和一个汉堡包， 然后另外一人给我拿了杯咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: a flat round piece of finely cut beef(= meat from a cow ) which is cooked and eaten in a bread bun

name: carpet
trans: n. 地毯；覆盖地面的一层厚东西vt. 给......铺地毯【僻】v. 训斥，责骂

sentences.english: The building has been carpeted throughout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里上上下下都铺了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责
detailed_translations.english: to cover a floor with carpet
heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

name: blur
trans: n. 模糊形状v. （使）变得模糊不清

sentences.english: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。

sentences.english: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
sentences.chinese: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

detailed_translations.english: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
a shape that you cannot see clearly

name: rally
trans: n. 集会v. 集合，召集

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: swarm
trans: n. 一大群vi. 蜂拥；挤满

sentences.english: Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

detailed_translations.english: If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way
a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

name: pilgrim
trans: n. 朝圣者

sentences.english: pilgrims visiting a holy shrine
sentences.chinese: 祭拜圣庙的朝圣者

detailed_translations.chinese: 朝圣者；漫游者；（美）最初的移民
detailed_translations.english: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place

name: drought
trans: n. 干旱；旱灾

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: handicap
trans: vt. 妨碍n. 阻碍；生理缺陷

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: heal
trans: vt. 治愈v. （使）康复，复原

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

name: mate
trans: n. 伴侣；朋友；同伴

sentences.english: He has found his ideal mate.
sentences.chinese: 他已经找到了理想的配偶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物
detailed_translations.english: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

name: bizarre
trans: a. 奇异的；古怪的

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: mock
trans: v. 嘲笑a. 假装的；模拟的

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: pierce
trans: v. 刺穿；穿透

sentences.english: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
sentences.chinese: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。

sentences.english: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
sentences.chinese: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部，接受了紧急手术。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

name: puzzle
trans: n. 难题；谜vt. 使困惑vi. 对......古古思索

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: rake
trans: n. 耙子v. 耙vi. 搜索

sentences.english: The searchlight raked the open ground around the prison.
sentences.chinese: 探照灯在监狱周围的空地上来回扫射。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索；用耙子耙；掠过，擦过
detailed_translations.english: to move a rake across a surface in order to make the soil level, gather dead leaves etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 耙子；斜度；钱耙；放荡的人，浪子
detailed_translations.english: a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc

name: token
trans: n. 象征；代币a. 象征性的；装模作样的

sentences.english: slot-machine tokens
sentences.chinese: 自动贩卖机使用的代用币

sentences.english: Please accept this gift as a small token of our appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 区区薄礼，略表谢意，还请笑纳。

detailed_translations.english: a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines

name: toss
trans: vt. 扔v. 摇摆n. 掷硬币决定

sentences.english: I’ve been tossing and turning all night.
sentences.chinese: 我一晚上辗转反侧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掷钱币来决定；翻来覆去
detailed_translations.english: to keep changing your position in bed because you cannot sleep

detailed_translations.chinese: 扔，抛，掷；猛抬；拌；掷；使摇动，使颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to throw something, especially something light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 掷钱币来决定； 猛抬头
detailed_translations.english: the act of throwing a coin in the air to decide something, especially who will do something first in a game

name: palm
trans: n. 手掌；棕搁树

sentences.english: He held the pebble in the palm of his hand .
sentences.chinese: 他把那颗卵石握在手心里。

detailed_translations.english: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things

name: feeble
trans: a. 虚弱的；无力的

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: beam
trans: n. 光线；梁v. 笑容满面

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: click
trans: v. 点击；使发出咔嗒声

sentences.english: The door clicked shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 门在我身后咔嗒一声关上了。

sentences.english: Mother clicked her tongue (= made a short sound to show disapproval ) and sighed.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈咂咂嘴，叹了口气。

sentences.english: Edmund clicked his fingers (= made a short sound to get someone’s attention ) for John to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙弹了个响指示意约翰跟着他。

sentences.english: Vogel clicked his heels (= hit the heels of his shoes together ) and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 沃格尔咔嗒一声并拢脚跟，鞠了个躬。

sentences.english: Twist the lever and the gears click into place .
sentences.chinese: 转动变速杆，排挡就咔嗒一声到位了。

sentences.english: You can check your e-mail with a click of your mouse.
sentences.chinese: 通过鼠标的一点你就能查电子邮件。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound
Click is also a noun

name: dim
trans: a. 暗淡的；模糊的v. （使）变模糊

sentences.english: in the dim light of the early dawn
sentences.chinese: 在微弱的晨曦里

sentences.english: a dim glow
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的微光

sentences.english: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。

detailed_translations.english: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well

name: holy
trans: a. 神圣的；圣洁的

sentences.english: the holy city of Varanasi
sentences.chinese: 圣城瓦拉纳西

detailed_translations.english: connected with God and religion

name: bachelor
trans: n. 单身汉；学士

sentences.english: Gerald was 38, and a confirmed bachelor (=  a man who has decided that he will never marry  ) .
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德38岁，抱定主意独身。

sentences.english: a Bachelor of Arts/Engineering/Science
sentences.chinese: 文学士；工程学士；理学士

detailed_translations.english: a man who has never been married

name: suck
trans: v. 吮吸，吸vt. 抽取；使卷入

sentences.english: They waited in silence and sucked their sweets.
sentences.chinese: 他们静静地等着，吮着糖果。

detailed_translations.english: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in
an act of sucking

name: stem
trans: n. （植物的）茎vt. 阻止vi起源于

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。
