detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: punch
trans: n. 重拳击打vt. 拳打

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: groan
trans: vi. 哼哼；抱怨n. 呻吟声

sentences.english: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我关掉电视时，孩子们都发出不满的抱怨声。

sentences.english: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
sentences.chinese: 理查德的笑话让你哭笑不得。

detailed_translations.english: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something

name: Plug
trans: n. 插头；塞子vt. 填塞；推广

name: stretch
trans: v. 伸展vi. 延伸n.  一段时间

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: shrink
trans: v. 缩小，收缩vi. 退缩；避开

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: Latin
trans: n. 拉丁语；拉丁人a. 拉丁语的；拉丁人的

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: I must brush up on my Latin.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把拉丁语重温一下。

sentences.english: This word comes from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这个词源于拉丁语。

detailed_translations.english: the language used in ancient Rome

name: squeeze
trans: v. 挤压n. 挤压；削减

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: starve
trans: v. （使）挨饿，饿死vt. 使极其缺乏

sentences.english: Thousands of people will starve if food doesn’t reach the city.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不能运到那座城市，成千上万的人就要饿死。

sentences.english: pictures of starving children
sentences.chinese: 饥饿儿童的照片

sentences.english: They’ll either die from the cold or starve to death (= die from lack of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要么会冻死，要么会饿死。

detailed_translations.english: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见；偏爱

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: twist
trans: vt. 曲解；拧v. 转动（身体部位）n. 转变

sentences.english: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手开始拧她拎着的那个包的拎柄。

sentences.english: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了，嘴巴慢慢一歪，带着嘲笑的意味。

detailed_translations.english: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape
a twisting action or movement

name: stake
trans: n. 桩；赌注；股份vt. 以......下赌注

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: rescue
trans: vt. 营救n. 营救；营救行动

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: haste
trans: n. 匆忙；仓促

sentences.english: Spelling mistakes are often just the result of haste.
sentences.chinese: 拼写错误经常是由于匆忙而造成的。

sentences.english: And if haste is the accelerator pedal, multitasking is overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果匆忙是加速器的踏板，一心多用就是超速档。

sentences.english: My workmate gestured, clarifying his intentions of using a forged(faked) passport in haste.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事打着手势，匆忙地解释着他使用假护照的意图。

detailed_translations.chinese: 匆忙， 急速； 草率
detailed_translations.english: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

name: spite
trans: n. 恶意；怨恨vt. 存心使苦恼

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.english: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.chinese: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.english: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.english: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.chinese: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or prevented by something
to deliberately annoy or upset someone

name: warrant
trans: vt. 使有必要n. 搜查令；许可证；依据,■

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: masculine
trans: a. 男性的；男子汉的；（某些语言中的词）阳性的

sentences.english: They’re nice curtains, but I’d prefer something a little more masculine.
sentences.chinese: 这些窗帘很好，但我更喜欢男性化一点的。

sentences.english: She has a very masculine voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的嗓音非常男性化。

sentences.english: Hunting was a typically masculine occupation.
sentences.chinese: 打猎是典型的男性消遣活动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 男性的；阳性的；男子气概的
detailed_translations.english: having qualities considered to be typical of men or of what men do

name: roundabout
trans: a. 迂回的；转弯抹角的n. 环形交叉路口

sentences.english: The bus took a very long and roundabout route .
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车路线很长，绕着圈子走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回的，绕道的；圆滚滚的
detailed_translations.english: a roundabout way of getting somewhere is longer and more complicated than necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回路线；环状交叉路口
detailed_translations.english: a raised circular area where three or more roads join together and which cars must drive around

name: lifetime
trans: n. 一生；使用期限

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

name: meantime
trans: n.  /ad,在此期间

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

name: southeast
trans: n. 东南;东南部a. /ad. （向）东南方（的）

sentences.english: the southeast quarter of the city
sentences.chinese: 该市的东南部

sentences.english: I know we have to go southeast, more or less.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我们大概得往东南方向走。

detailed_translations.english: a southeast wind comes from the southeast
the direction that is exactly between south and east
If you go southeast, you travel toward the southeast

name: sportsman
trans: n. 运动员

sentences.english: He’s a very keen sportsman .
sentences.chinese: 他是个非常喜爱运动的人。

sentences.english: a talented all-round sportsman
sentences.chinese: 一名有天赋的全能运动员

detailed_translations.english: a man who plays several different sports

name: typewriter
trans: n. 打字机

sentences.english: She tapped out a letter on the typewriter.
sentences.chinese: 她用打字机打出了一封信。

sentences.english: He tapped out an article on the typewriter.
sentences.chinese: 他用打字机打出了一篇文章。

sentences.english: The secretary transcribed those letters on the typewriter.
sentences.chinese: 秘书用打字机打出了那些信。

detailed_translations.english: a machine with keys that you press in order to print letters of the alphabet onto paper

name: wardrobe
trans: n. 衣橱，衣柜；全部衣物；服装部

sentences.english: Can you hang these in the wardrobe, please?
sentences.chinese: 请你把这些衣服挂到衣橱里去好吗？

sentences.english: fitted/built-in wardrobes (=wardrobes built against a wall or fitted between two walls)
sentences.chinese: 固定式/嵌入式衣柜

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in

name: overturn
trans: v. （使）翻倒vt. 推翻，撤销（判决等）

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: shorthand
trans: n. 速记（法）；简略的表达方式

sentences.english: a secretary who takes shorthand (= writes in shorthand )
sentences.chinese: 会速记的秘书

detailed_translations.english: a fast method of writing using special signs or shorter forms to represent letters, words, and phrases

name: withstand
trans: vt. 承受；经受住

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

name: safeguard
trans: v. 保护，保卫n. 保护措施

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: standpoint
trans: n. 角度；立场；观点

sentences.english: a discussion of marriage from the standpoint of women
sentences.chinese: 从女性角度对婚姻的探讨

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about people, situations, ideas etc

name: viewpoint
trans: n. 观点；角度

sentences.english: Try and think of it from the child’s viewpoint.
sentences.chinese: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

name: guideline
trans: n.  [pl.]指导方针；参考

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: masterpiece
trans: n. 杰作；名著；典范

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

name: headline
trans: n. （报纸的）大字标题；[pl.][the~s]新闻提要

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

name: drawback
trans: n. 缺点

sentences.english: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 这是座很不错的城市，唯一的不足就是天气。

detailed_translations.english: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

name: outfit
trans: n. 全套服装；团队vt. 配备；装备

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

name: breed
trans: vt. 饲养vi. （动物）繁殖n. 品种；类型

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: era
trans: n. 时代

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: blunder
trans: n. 愚蠢的错误vi. 犯愚蠢的错误；跌跌撞撞

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: stain
trans: v. 留下污渍vt. 败坏（名声）n. 污点

sentences.english: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

name: thrill
trans: n. 兴奋（感）；一阵强烈的感觉vt. 使激动

sentences.english: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.chinese: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.english: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.english: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.chinese: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel excited and happy

name: threshold
trans: n. 门槛；起始点；开端

sentences.english: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 她打开门，跨过门槛。

sentences.english: The creature is on the threshold of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这种生物已濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

name: weird
trans: a. 怪异的；诡异的

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: vary
trans: vi. 变化；不同

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: tuck
trans: vt. 塞进

sentences.english: You tuck your secret away in an unexpected place, like an MP3 or a photo file, to conceal the fact you even shared any information at all.
sentences.chinese: 你将你的秘密“卷起来”，放在一个意想不到的地方，比如MP3或照片文件，这样就掩盖了你曾经分享信息的事实。

detailed_translations.english: a pleat or fold in a part of a garment, usually stitched down so as to make it a better fit or as decoration

name: blunt
trans: a. 钝的；直言不讳的vt. 使减弱

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: bronze
trans: n. 青铜a. 青铜制的

sentences.english: a bell cast in bronze
sentences.chinese: 青铜浇铸的一口钟

detailed_translations.english: a hard metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  tin
made of bronze

name: veto
trans: n. 否决权vt. 行使否决权；反对

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: scatter
trans: v. （使）散开vt. 撒n. 散落/'

sentences.english: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people or animals scatter, or if something scatters them, they move quickly in different directions

name: scorn
trans: vt. /n. 轻蔑，鄙视

sentences.english: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们对这个提议报以轻蔑的态度。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑， 鄙视； 拒绝， 不屑
detailed_translations.english: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

name: deed
trans: n. 行为；事迹；证书；契约

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

sentences.english: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
sentences.chinese: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝，她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据
detailed_translations.english: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

name: toast
trans: n. 吐司；敬酒vt. 烤（面包等）；为......举杯敬酒

sentences.english: I had a piece of toast for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我早饭吃了一片吐司。

sentences.english: I toasted the cheese sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 我烤了干酪三明治。

detailed_translations.english: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft
to make bread or other food brown by placing it close to heat

name: crawl
trans: vi. 爬,爬行；缓慢行进n. 缓慢行进

sentences.english: We crawled into bed at 2 am.
sentences.chinese: 我们凌晨两点爬上了床。

detailed_translations.english: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground
a way of swimming in which you lie on your stomach and move one arm, and then the other, over your head

name: tunnel
trans: n. 隧道v. 挖地道

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: tilt
trans: v. （使）倾斜n. 倾斜

sentences.english: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。

sentences.english: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
sentences.chinese: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

detailed_translations.english: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other

name: steer
trans: vt. 引导v. 驾驶（船、汽车等）

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

name: foster
trans: vt. 促进v. 抚育a. 寄养的

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: rot
trans: v. （使）腐烂n. 腐烂

sentences.english: the smell of rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的气味

sentences.english: wood that is soft with rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂变软的木头

detailed_translations.english: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: （表示厌恶、蔑视、烦恼等）胡说；糟了

name: fade
trans: v. （使）变淡vi. 逐渐消失

sentences.english: the fading evening light
sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.english: The sun had faded the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

name: tragic
trans: a. 悲惨的；悲剧的

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: bleak
trans: a. 暗淡的；阴冷的；荒凉的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: plunge
trans: n. 突然跌落；猛跌v. （使）突然下落

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

name: plot
trans: n. 故事情节v. 密谋

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: wander
trans: v. /n. 闲逛

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: spoil
trans: vt. 破坏;毁掉；宠坏n.  [pl.] [the's]战利品

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: infant
trans: n. 婴儿a. 供婴幼儿用的；初期的

sentences.english: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的皮肤非常敏感。

sentences.english: infant formula milk
sentences.chinese: 婴(幼)儿配方奶

detailed_translations.english: a baby or very young child
intended for babies or very young children

name: forge
trans: vt. 伪造；建立；锻造；艰苦干成

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: column
trans: n. （报刊的）专栏；柱；（数字的）列

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: dazzle
trans: vt. 使目眩；使倾倒n. 耀眼炫目

sentences.english: a deer dazzled by the headlights
sentences.chinese: 被车头灯光照得目眩的鹿

sentences.english: As children, we were dazzled by my uncle’s good looks and charm.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，我叔叔的英俊外表和魅力令我们倾倒。

detailed_translations.english: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

name: gamble
trans: n. 赌博；冒险v. 赌博

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

sentences.english: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了他的内阁。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.chinese: 赌博； 投机， 冒险
detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

name: thrift
trans: n. 节俭

sentences.english: They were rightly praised for their thrift and enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 他们因勤俭节约和开创精神而受到了应得的表扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭；节约；[植] 海石竹
detailed_translations.english: wise and careful use of money, so that none is wasted

name: obey
trans: v. 服从;遵守

sentences.english: The little boy made no effort to obey.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩不肯服从。

sentences.english: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.chinese: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

name: scarce
trans: a. 短缺的，不足的；稀少的ad. 几乎不

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: shrewd
trans: a. 精明的，敏锐的；有眼光的；判断准确的

sentences.english: Malcolm is a shrewd businessman.
sentences.chinese: 马尔科姆是个精明的商人。

sentences.english: She was shrewd enough to guess who was responsible.
sentences.chinese: 她很精明，一猜就知道是谁干的。

sentences.english: Capra looked at her with shrewd eyes.
sentences.chinese: 卡普拉眼神犀利地看着她。

detailed_translations.english: good at judging what people or situations are really like

name: stumble
trans: vi. 绊脚；踉跄；跌跌撞撞地走

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun
